1379                            atom_id  = line_split [1]
1380                            atom_name = line_split [3]
1381                            atom_resname = line_split [5]
1382                            chain_id = line_split [7]
1383                            atom_radius = line_split [9]
1384
1385                            diameter = ((float(atom_radius)*2.0)*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1386
1387                            label_dict [int(atom_id)] = [atom_name , atom_resname, chain_id, diameter]
1388
1389                            if atom_name == 'CA' or label_CA == True:
1390                                label_CA = True
1391
1392                            if atom_name != 'CA' and atom_name != 'Ca':
1393                                protein_seq_list.append(atom_name)                        
1394
1395                        elif line_header == 'bond' :
1396                            atom_bond = line_split [1] 
1397
1398                        elif line_header.isnumeric (): 
1399                            particle_id = line_split [0]
1400                            particle_coord = line_split [1:] 
1401                            particle_coord = [float(i) for i in particle_coord]
1402
1403                            coord_list.append (particle_coord)
1404
1405        axes_list = [0,1,2]
1406        updated_coordinates_list = []
1407
1408        # Pablo-NOTE:
1409        # 1- Lines 1397-1403 could be done before in line 1389
1410        # 2- Definir el diametro del CA
1411        # 3- Cambiar load_protein_vtf_in_df por read_protein_vtf --> topology_dict
1412        # 4- Nueva funcion define_protein ()
1413        # 5- Tener cuidado con label_CA
1414        # 6- Limpiar codigo, borrar variables e condiciones innecesarias
1415        # 7- Hacer funciones de las lineas repetidas de codigo entre create_molecule y create_protein (las que hacen copias en el df)
1416
1417        for pos in coord_list:
1418            updated_pos = self.np.zeros(3,)
1419            for axis in axes_list:
1420                updated_pos[axis] = (pos[axis]*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1421            updated_coordinates_list.append (updated_pos.tolist())
1422
1423        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1424
1425        print (f'Protein Sequence: {protein_sequence}')
1426
1427        numbered_resname = []
1428        i = 0   
1429        
1430        for atom_id in label_dict.keys():
1431    
1432            if atom_id == 1:
1433                atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1434                updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1435                numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1436
1437            elif atom_id != 1: 
1438            
1439                if label_dict[atom_id-1][1] != label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1440                    i += 1                    
1441                    count = 1
1442                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1443                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1444                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1445                    
1446                elif label_dict[atom_id-1][1] == label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1447                    if count == 2 or label_dict[atom_id][1] == 'GLY':
1448                        i +=1  
1449                        count = 0
1450                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1451                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1452                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1453                    count +=1
1454
1455        topology_dict = {}
1456
1457        for i in range (0, len(numbered_resname)):   
1458            topology_dict [numbered_resname[i][0]] = {'initial_pos': updated_coordinates_list[i] ,'chain_id':numbered_resname[i][1], 'diameter':numbered_resname[i][2] }
1459
1460        #### CORTAR
1461
1462        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1463
1464        index = len(self.df)
1465        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1466        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1467        self.df.at [index,'model'] = '2beadAA' 
1468
1469        if label_CA:
1470            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1471
1472        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1473
1474        residue_list = []
1475
1476        for residue_name in clean_sequence:
1477
1478            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1479
1480                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1481                    central_bead = residue_name
1482                    side_chains = []
1483                else:
1484                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1485                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1486
1487                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1488                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1489                                    side_chains = side_chains)
1490            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1491
1492        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = protein_sequence  
1493        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1494
1495        return topology_dict
1496
1497    def print_reduced_units(self):
1498        """
1499        Prints the  current set of reduced units defined in pyMBE.units.
1500        """
1501        print("\nCurrent set of reduced units:")
1502        unit_length=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_length')
1503        unit_energy=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_energy')
1504        unit_charge=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_charge')
1505        print(unit_length.to('nm'), "=", unit_length)
1506        print(unit_energy.to('J'), "=", unit_energy)
1507        print('Temperature:', (self.kT/self.Kb).to("K"))
1508        print(unit_charge.to('C'), "=", unit_charge)
1509        print()
1510
1511    def propose_unused_type(self):
1512        """
1513        Searches in `pmb.df` all the different particle types defined and returns a new one.
1514
1515        Returns:
1516            unused_type(`int`): unused particle type
1517        """
1518        type_map=self.get_type_map()
1519        if type_map == {}:    
1520            unused_type = 0
1521        else:
1522            unused_type=max(type_map.values())+1    
1523        return unused_type
1524
1525    def protein_sequence_parser(self, sequence):
1526        '''
1527        Parses `sequence` to the one letter code for aminoacids.
1528        
1529        Args:
1530            sequence(`str` or `lst`): Sequence of the aminoacid. 
1531
1532        Returns:
1533            clean_sequence(`list`): `sequence` using the one letter code.
1534        
1535        Note:
1536            - Accepted formats for `sequence` are:
1537                - `lst` with one letter or three letter code of each aminoacid in each element
1538                - `str` with the sequence using the one letter code
1539                - `str` with the squence using the three letter code, each aminoacid must be separated by a hyphon "-"
1540        
1541        '''
1542        # Aminoacid key
1543        keys={"ALA": "A",
1544                "ARG": "R",
1545                "ASN": "N",
1546                "ASP": "D",
1547                "CYS": "C",
1548                "GLU": "E",
1549                "GLN": "Q",
1550                "GLY": "G",
1551                "HIS": "H",
1552                "ILE": "I",
1553                "LEU": "L",
1554                "LYS": "K",
1555                "MET": "M",
1556                "PHE": "F",
1557                "PRO": "P",
1558                "SER": "S",
1559                "THR": "T",
1560                "TRP": "W",
1561                "TYR": "Y",
1562                "VAL": "V",
1563                "PSER": "J",
1564                "PTHR": "U",
1565                "PTyr": "Z",
1566                "NH2": "n",
1567                "COOH": "c"}
1568        clean_sequence=[]
1569        if isinstance(sequence, str):
1570            if (sequence.find("-") != -1):
1571                splited_sequence=sequence.split("-")
1572                for residue in splited_sequence:
1573                    if len(residue) == 1:
1574                        if residue in keys.values():
1575                            residue_ok=residue
1576                        else:
1577                            if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1578                                residue_ok=residue.upper()
1579                            else:
1580                                raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue given: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1581                        clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1582                    else:
1583                        if residue in keys.keys():
1584                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue])
1585                        else:
1586                            if (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1587                                clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1588                            else:
1589                                raise ValueError("Unknown  code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1590            else:
1591                for residue in sequence:
1592                    if residue in keys.values():
1593                        residue_ok=residue
1594                    else:
1595                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1596                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1597                        else:
1598                            raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1599                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1600        if isinstance(sequence, list):
1601            for residue in sequence:
1602                    if residue in keys.values():
1603                        residue_ok=residue
1604                    else:
1605                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1606                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1607                        elif (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1608                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1609                        else:
1610                            raise ValueError("Unknown code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1611                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1612        return clean_sequence
1613
1614    def search_bond (self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False) :
1615        """
1616        Searches for bonds between the particle types given by `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1617        If `use_default_bond` is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns that default bond instead.
1618        If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return nothing. If `hard_check` is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.
1619
1620        Args:
1621            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1622            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1623            hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False. 
1624            use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to False. 
1625
1626        Returns:
1627            bond (cls): bond object from the espressomd library.
1628        
1629        Note:
1630            - If `use_default_bond`=True and no bond is defined between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`, it returns the default bond defined in `pmb.df`.
1631            - If `hard_check`=`True` stops the code when no bond is found.
1632        """
1633        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1634                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1635                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
1636        if bond_key:
1637            return self.df[self.df['name']==bond_key].bond_object.values[0]
1638        else:
1639            print("Bond not defined between particles ", particle_name1, " and ", particle_name2)    
1640            if hard_check:
1641                exit()
1642            else:
1643                return
1644
1645    def set_particle_acidity(self, name, acidity='inert', default_charge=0, pka=None):
1646        """
1647        Sets the particle acidity if its acidic or basic creates `state_one` and `state_two` with the protonated and 
1648        deprotonated states. In each state is set: `label`,`charge` and `es_type`. If its inert it will define only `state_one`
1649
1650        Args:
1651            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`. 
1652            acidity (`str`): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1653            default_charge (`int`): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
1654            pka (`float`, optional):  If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1655        """
1656        acidity_valid_keys = ['inert','acidic', 'basic']
1657        if acidity not in acidity_valid_keys:
1658            raise ValueError(self.df[name].name +' provided acidity not supported, valid keys are ', acidity_valid_keys)   
1659        for index in self.df[self.df['name']==name].index:       
1660            if pka:
1661                self.add_value_to_df(key=('pka',''),index=index,new_value=pka)
1662            self.add_value_to_df(key=('acidity',''),index=index,new_value=acidity) 
1663            if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_one','es_type')):
1664                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())  
1665            if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'inert':
1666                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=default_charge)
1667                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1668            else:
1669                protonated_label = f'{name}H'
1670                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=protonated_label)
1671                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1672                if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_two','es_type')):
1673                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())
1674                if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'acidic':        
1675                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)
1676                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=-1)
1677                elif self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'basic':
1678                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=+1)
1679                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)   
1680        return
1681
1682    
1683    
1684    def set_reduced_units(self, unit_length=None,unit_charge=None,temperature=None):
1685        """
1686        Sets the set of reduced units used by pyMBE.units and it prints it.
1687
1688        Args:
1689            unit_length (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of length defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1690            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1691            temperature (`obj`,optional): Temperature of the system, defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1692
1693        Note:
1694            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
1695            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
1696            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
1697        """
1698        self.units=self.pint.UnitRegistry()
1699        if unit_length is None:
1700            unit_length=0.355*self.units.nm
1701        if temperature is None:
1702            temperature=298.15 * self.units.K
1703        if unit_charge is None:
1704            unit_charge=self.units.e
1705        self.N_A=6.02214076e23 / self.units.mol
1706        self.Kb=1.38064852e-23 * self.units.J / self.units.K
1707        self.e=1.60217662e-19 *self.units.C
1708        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
1709        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT} ')
1710        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
1711        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = {unit_charge}')        
1712        self.print_reduced_units()
1713        return
1714
1715    def setup_constantpH_reactions_in_espresso(self, counter_ion, constant_pH, SEED, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
1716        """
1717        Sets up the Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic `particles` defined in `pmb.df` to be sampled in the constant pH ensamble. 
1718
1719        Args:
1720            counter_ion(`str`): `name` of the counter_ion `particle`.
1721            constant_pH(`float`): pH-value.
1722            SEED(`int`): Seed for the random number generator.
1723            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): Bellow this value, no particles will be inserted.
1724            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius per each espresso_type. Defaults to `False`.
1725            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
1726        Returns:
1727            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ConstantpHEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
1728            sucessfull_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
1729        """
1730        from espressomd import reaction_methods
1731        if exclusion_range is None:
1732            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
1733        if pka_set is None:
1734            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
1735        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1736        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
1737            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
1738        else:
1739            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
1740        
1741        RE = reaction_methods.ConstantpHEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
1742                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
1743                                                    seed=SEED, 
1744                                                    constant_pH=constant_pH,
1745                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
1746                                                    )
1747        sucessfull_reactions_labels=[]
1748        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
1749        for name in pka_set.keys():
1750            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
1751                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in sg.type_map')
1752                continue
1753            gamma=10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value']
1754            state_one_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1755            state_two_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
1756            counter_ion_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==counter_ion].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1757            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma,
1758                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
1759                            product_types=[state_two_type, counter_ion_type],
1760                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
1761                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
1762                            counter_ion_type: charge_map[counter_ion_type]})
1763            sucessfull_reactions_labels.append(name)
1764        return RE, sucessfull_reactions_labels
1765
1766    def setup_df (self):
1767        """
1768        Sets up the pyMBE's dataframe `pymbe.df`
1769        """
1770
1771        columns_name = self.pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples ([
1772                        ('name',''),
1773                        ('pmb_type',''),
1774                        ('particle_id',''), 
1775                        ('particle_id2',''),
1776                        ('residue_id',''),
1777                        ('molecule_id',''),
1778                        ('acidity',''),
1779                        ('pka',''),
1780                        ('central_bead',''),
1781                        ('side_chains',''),
1782                        ('residue_list',''),
1783                        ('model',''),
1784                        ('diameter',''),
1785                        ('epsilon',''),
1786                        ('state_one','label'),
1787                        ('state_one','es_type'),
1788                        ('state_one','charge'),
1789                        ('state_two','label'),
1790                        ('state_two','es_type'),
1791                        ('state_two','charge'),
1792                        ('sequence',''),
1793                        ('bond_object',''),
1794                        ('parameters_of_the_potential','')
1795                        ])
1796
1797        self.df = self.pd.DataFrame (columns = columns_name)
1798      
1799        return 
1800
1801
1802    def setup_lj_interactions_in_espresso (self, espresso_system, cutoff=None, shift='auto', combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'):
1803        """
1804        Sets up the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential between all pairs of particle types with values for `diameter` and `epsilon` stored in `pymbe.df`.
1805        Stores the parameters loaded into  ESPResSo for each type pair in `pymbe.df`.
1806        Assumes that the LJ interactions between all particles will have the same `cutoff`, `shift` and `combining_rule`.
1807        Check the documentation of ESPResSo for more info about the potential https://espressomd.github.io/doc4.2.0/inter_non-bonded.html
1808
1809        Args:
1810            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1811            cutoff(`float`, optional): cut-off length of the LJ potential. Defaults to None.
1812            shift (`string`, optional): If set to `auto` shifts the potential to be continous at `cutoff`. Defaults to `auto`.
1813            combining_rule (`string`, optional): combining rule used to calculate `sigma` and `epsilon` for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
1814
1815        Note:
1816            - If no `cutoff`  is given, its value is set to 2**(1./6.) in reduced_lenght units, corresponding to a purely steric potential.
1817            - Currently, the only `combining_rule` supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
1818        """
1819        from itertools import combinations_with_replacement
1820        sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1821        implemented_combinatiorial_rules = ['Lorentz-Berthelot']
1822        compulsory_parameters_in_df = ['diameter','epsilon']
1823        if combining_rule not in implemented_combinatiorial_rules:
1824            raise ValueError('In the current version of pyMBE, the only combinatorial rules implemented are ', implemented_combinatiorial_rules)
1825        if cutoff is None:
1826            cutoff=2**(1./6.)*self.units('reduced_length')
1827        particles_types_with_LJ_parameters = []
1828        particles_types_without_LJ_parameters= []
1829        for particle_type in self.get_type_map().values():
1830            check_list=[]
1831            for key in compulsory_parameters_in_df:
1832                value_in_df=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle_type,
1833                                                        column_name=key)
1834                check_list.append(self.np.isnan(value_in_df))
1835            if any(check_list):
1836                particles_types_without_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1837            else:
1838                particles_types_with_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1839        for type_pair in combinations_with_replacement(particles_types_with_LJ_parameters, 2):
1840            pair_parameters={}
1841            for ptype in type_pair:
1842                pair_parameters[ptype]={}
1843                pair_parameters[ptype]["label"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='label')
1844                pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='diameter')
1845                pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='epsilon')
1846            if combining_rule == 'Lorentz-Berthelot':
1847                combined_sigma=0
1848                epsilon=1
1849                for ptype in type_pair:
1850                    combined_sigma+=pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]
1851                    epsilon*=pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]
1852                offset=combined_sigma/2.-sigma
1853                epsilon=self.np.sqrt(epsilon)
1854            else:
1855                raise ValueError('Undefined combination rule, please report this bug to the developers')
1856            espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0],type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.set_params(epsilon = epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude, 
1857                                                                                    sigma = sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1858                                                                                    cutoff = cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude,
1859                                                                                    offset = offset.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1860                                                                                    shift = shift)                                                                                          
1861            index = len(self.df)
1862            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = f'LJ: {pair_parameters[type_pair[0]]["label"]}-{pair_parameters[type_pair[1]]["label"]}'
1863            lj_params=espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0], type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.get_params()
1864            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1865                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1866                                new_value='LennardJones')
1867            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1868                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1869                                new_value=self.json.dumps(lj_params))                
1870        if particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1871            non_parametrized_labels=[]
1872            for ptype in particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1873                non_parametrized_labels.append(self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, 
1874                                                                            column_name='label')) 
1875            print('WARNING: missing LJ parameters for the following particle labels:')
1876            print(non_parametrized_labels)
1877            print('no interaction has been added for those particles in ESPResSo')
1878        return
1879
1880    def setup_particle_diameter (self,topology_dict):
1881        '''
1882        Sets up the diameter of the particles in `positions`.
1883
1884        Args:
1885            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1886        '''
1887        import re 
1888   
1889        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1890            residue_name = re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1891            residue_number = re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
1892            residue_diameter  = topology_dict[residue]['diameter']
1893            diameter = residue_diameter*self.units.nm
1894            index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_number) & (self.df['name']==residue_name) ].index.values[0]
1895            self.add_value_to_df(key= ('diameter',''),
1896                        index=int (index),
1897                        new_value=diameter)
1898            
1899        return 
1900
1901    def write_output_vtf_file (self, espresso_system, filename):
1902        '''
1903        Writes a snapshot of `espresso_system` on the vtf file `filename`.
1904
1905        Args:
1906            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1907            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file.
1908
1909        '''
1910        box = espresso_system.box_l[0]
1911        with open(filename, mode='w+t') as coordinates:
1912            coordinates.write (f'unitcell {box} {box} {box} \n')
1913            for particle in espresso_system.part: 
1914                type_label = self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle.type, column_name='label')
1915                coordinates.write (f'atom {particle.id} radius 1 name {type_label} type {type_label}\n' )
1916            coordinates.write (f'timestep indexed\n')
1917            for particle in espresso_system.part:
1918                coordinates.write (f'{particle.id} \t {particle.pos[0]} \t {particle.pos[1]} \t {particle.pos[2]}\n')
1919        return 
1920
class pymbe_library: 
   2class pymbe_library():
   3    """
   4    The library for the Molecular Brewer for ESPResSo (pyMBE)
   5
   6    Attributes:
   7        N_A(`obj`): Avogadro number using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   8        Kb(`obj`): Boltzmann constant using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   9        e(`obj`): Elemental charge using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
  10        df(`obj`): PandasDataframe used to bookkeep all the information stored in pyMBE. Typically refered as `pmb.df`. 
  11        kT(`obj`): Thermal energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. it is used as the unit of reduced energy.
  12    """
  13    import pint
  14    import numpy as np
  15    import pandas as pd 
  16    import json
  17    units = pint.UnitRegistry()
  18    N_A=6.02214076e23    / units.mol
  19    Kb=1.38064852e-23    * units.J / units.K
  20    e=1.60217662e-19 *units.C
  21    df=None
  22    kT=None
  23
  24    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
  25        """
  26        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
  27        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkepping.
  28
  29        Args:
  30            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  31            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  32            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
  33        
  34        Note:
  35            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  36            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  37            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
  38        """
  39        # Default definitions of reduced units
  40        if temperature is None:
  41            temperature= 298.15 * self.units.K
  42        if unit_length is None:
  43            unit_length= 0.355 * self.units.nm
  44        if unit_charge is None:
  45            unit_charge=self.units.e
  46        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
  47        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT}')
  48        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
  49        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = 1*e')
  50        self.setup_df()
  51        return
  52    
  53    def activate_motion_of_rigid_object (self, name, espresso_system):
  54        '''
  55        Activates the motion of the rigid object `name` in the `espresso_system`.
  56
  57        Args:
  58            name(`str`): Label of the object.
  59            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  60
  61        Note:
  62            - It requires that espressodmd has the following feautures activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
  63        '''
  64        print ('activate_motion_of_rigid_object requires that espressodmd has the following feautures activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"]')
  65        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
  66        if pmb_type != 'protein':
  67            raise ValueError (f'The pmb_type: {pmb_type} is not currently supported. The supported pmb_type is: protein')
  68        molecule_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].molecule_id.to_list()
  69        for molecule_id in molecule_ids_list:    
  70            particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
  71            center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
  72            rigid_object_center = espresso_system.part.add(pos=center_of_mass,
  73                                                           rotation=[True,True,True], 
  74                                                           type=self.propose_unused_type())
  75            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
  76                pid = espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id)
  77                pid.vs_auto_relate_to(rigid_object_center.id)
  78        return
  79
  80    def add_bond_in_df (self,particle_id1,particle_id2, use_default_bond=False):
  81        """
  82        Adds a bond entry on the `pymbe.df` storing the particle_ids of the two bonded.
  83
  84        Args:
  85            particle_id1 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  86            particle_id2 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  87            use_default_bond (`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`. Defaults to False.
  88        """
  89        particle_name1 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id1].name.values[0]
  90        particle_name2 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id2].name.values[0]
  91        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1,
  92                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
  93                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
  94        if not bond_key:
  95            return
  96        self.copy_df_entry(name=bond_key,column_name='particle_id2',number_of_copies=1)
  97        indexs = self.np.where(self.df['name']==bond_key)
  98        index_list = list (indexs[0])
  99        used_bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id2'].notnull()]
 100        #without this drop the program crashes when dropping duplicates because the 'bond' column is a dict
 101        used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop([('bond_object','')],axis =1 )
 102        if len(used_bond_df.index) > 1: 
 103            used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')
 104        used_bond_index = used_bond_df.index.to_list()
 105        for index in index_list:
 106            if index not in used_bond_index:
 107                self.clean_df_row(index=int(index))
 108                self.df.at[index,'particle_id'] = particle_id1
 109                self.df.at[index,'particle_id2'] = particle_id2
 110                break
 111        return
 112
 113    def add_bonds_to_espresso (self, espresso_system) :
 114        """
 115        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
 116
 117        Args:
 118            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
 119        """
 120
 121        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
 122            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
 123            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
 124            for bond in bond_list:
 125                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
 126        else:
 127            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
 128        
 129        return
 130
 131    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
 132        """
 133        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
 134
 135        Args:
 136
 137            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
 138            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
 139            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
 140        """
 141        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
 142        index = int (index)
 143        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
 144        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 145        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
 146            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
 147            if warning:
 148                if old_value != new_value:
 149                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
 150                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
 151                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
 152                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
 153        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
 154        return
 155
 156    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule (self,molecule_id, espresso_system):
 157        """
 158        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
 159
 160        Args:
 161            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 162            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 163        
 164        Returns:
 165            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
 166        """
 167        total_beads = 0
 168        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
 169        axis_list = [0,1,2]
 170        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 171        for pid in particle_id_list:
 172            total_beads +=1 
 173            for axis in axis_list:
 174                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
 175        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
 176        return center_of_mass
 177
 178    def calculate_HH(self, sequence, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 179        """
 180        Calculates the ideal Henderson-Hasselbach titration curve of `sequence`.
 181
 182        Args:
 183            sequence(`lst`): List of `name`s of particles.
 184            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
 185            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 186
 187        Returns:
 188            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbach prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
 189
 190        Note:
 191            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 192            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 193        """
 194        if pH_list is None:
 195            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 196        if pka_set is None:
 197            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 198        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 199        Z_HH=[]
 200        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 201            Z=0
 202            for name in sequence: 
 203                if name in pka_set.keys():
 204                    if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 205                        psi=-1
 206                    elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
 207                        psi=+1
 208                    else:
 209                        psi=0
 210                    Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))                      
 211            Z_HH.append(Z)
 212        return Z_HH
 213
 214    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box (self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 215        """
 216        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
 217        
 218        Args:
 219            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 220            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 221        """
 222        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
 223        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
 224        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
 225        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
 226        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
 227            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 228            for pid in particle_id_list:
 229                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
 230                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
 231        return 
 232
 233    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self,index,key):
 234        """
 235        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
 236
 237        Args:
 238            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
 239            key(`str`): Column label to check.
 240
 241        Returns:
 242            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
 243        """
 244        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 245        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])
 246
 247    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df (self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
 248        """
 249        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
 250
 251        Args:
 252            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
 253            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
 254
 255        Returns:
 256            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
 257        """
 258        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
 259            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 260            if  current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
 261                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
 262            return True            
 263        else:
 264            return False
 265
 266    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
 267        """
 268        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
 269       
 270        Args:
 271            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 272        """
 273        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
 274        for required_key in required_keys:
 275            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
 276                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
 277                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
 278        return
 279
 280    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
 281        """
 282        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by asigning them a np.nan value.
 283
 284        Args:
 285            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
 286            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
 287        """   
 288        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
 289            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
 290        return
 291
 292    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
 293        '''
 294        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
 295
 296        Args:
 297            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 298            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
 299            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
 300        
 301        Note:
 302            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
 303        '''
 304
 305        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
 306        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
 307            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
 308        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
 309        if number_of_copies != 1:           
 310            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
 311                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
 312            else:
 313                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 314                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 315                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 316            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
 317            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
 318        else:
 319            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
 320                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 321                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 322                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 323                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
 324        return
 325
 326    def create_added_salt_in_espresso(self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
 327        """
 328        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
 329
 330        Args:
 331            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of a espresso system object.
 332            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 333            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 334            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
 335            
 336        Returns:
 337            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
 338        """
 339        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 340        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
 341        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
 342            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
 343        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
 344            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be positive, charge ', anion_name_charge)
 345        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
 346        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
 347        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
 348            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 349            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
 350        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
 351            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 352            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
 353        else:
 354            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
 355        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
 356        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
 357        self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
 358        self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
 359        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
 360        return c_salt_calculated
 361
 362    def create_counterions_in_espresso(self, pmb_object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
 363        """
 364        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
 365        
 366        Args:
 367            pmb_object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
 368            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 369            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 370            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 371
 372        Returns: 
 373            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
 374        """
 375        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 376        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 377        object_ids = self.df.loc [self.df['pmb_type']== pmb_object_name].particle_id.dropna().tolist()
 378        counterion_number={}
 379        object_charge={}
 380        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
 381            object_charge[name]=0
 382        for id in object_ids:
 383            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
 384                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 385            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
 386                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 387        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
 388            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
 389        else:
 390            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
 391        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
 392            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
 393        else:
 394            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
 395        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
 396            self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
 397        else:
 398            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
 399        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
 400            self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
 401        else:
 402            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
 403        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
 404        for name in counterion_number.keys():
 405            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
 406        return counterion_number
 407
 408    def create_molecule_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_molecules,espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 409        """
 410        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 411
 412        Args:
 413            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 414            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 415            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
 416            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
 417            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
 418        Returns:
 419            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
 420        """
 421        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
 422            return
 423        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 424                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
 425            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
 426        first_residue = True
 427        molecule_info = []
 428        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
 429        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 430                        column_name='molecule_id',
 431                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
 432        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 433        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
 434        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 435        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:          
 436            self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
 437            if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
 438                molecule_id = 0        
 439            else:
 440                # check if a residue is part of another molecule
 441                check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
 442                pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
 443                if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == 'molecule' :              
 444                    for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
 445                        if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
 446                            molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
 447                            break
 448                else:
 449                    molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
 450            #assigns molecule_id to the residue defined       
 451            self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
 452                                index=int (molecule_index),
 453                                new_value=molecule_id, 
 454                                warning=False)
 455            for residue in residue_list:
 456                if first_residue:
 457                    residue_position = first_residue_position
 458                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
 459                                                                radius=1, 
 460                                                                n_samples=1)[0]
 461                    residues_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=residue,
 462                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 463                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 464                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
 465                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
 466                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
 467                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
 468                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 469                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 470                                            index=int (index),
 471                                            new_value=molecule_id)
 472                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 473                    previous_residue = residue
 474                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 475                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 476                    first_residue = False          
 477                else:                    
 478                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
 479                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
 480                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 481                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 482                                            hard_check=True, 
 483                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 484                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*bond.params.get('r_0')  
 485                    residues_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=residue, 
 486                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 487                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 488                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
 489                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
 490                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
 491                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 492                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
 493                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
 494                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 495                                                index=int (index),
 496                                                new_value=molecule_id,
 497                                                warning=False)            
 498                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 499                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
 500                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 501                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
 502                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
 503                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 504                    previous_residue = residue                    
 505                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
 506            first_residue = True
 507        return molecule_info
 508    
 509    def create_particle_in_espresso(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
 510        """
 511        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
 512        
 513        Args:
 514            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
 515            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 516            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
 517            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
 518            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
 519        Returns:
 520            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
 521        """       
 522        if number_of_particles <=0:
 523            return
 524        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
 525            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
 526        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
 527        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
 528        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
 529        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 530        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 531        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
 532        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 533        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
 534        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
 535        created_pid_list=[]
 536        for index in range (number_of_particles):
 537            df_index=int (index_list[index])
 538            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
 539            if position is None:
 540                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
 541            else:
 542                particle_position = position[index]
 543            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
 544                bead_id = 0
 545            else:
 546                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
 547            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
 548            
 549            espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
 550            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
 551        return created_pid_list
 552
 553    def create_pmb_object_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 554        """
 555        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
 556        
 557        Args:
 558            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
 559            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
 560            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a espresso system object from espressomd library.
 561            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
 562            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
 563
 564        Note:
 565            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
 566        """
 567        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
 568        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 569        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 570            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 571        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 572            self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
 573        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 574            self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 575        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
 576            self.create_molecule_in_espresso(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
 577        return
 578
 579    def create_protein_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, positions):
 580        """
 581        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` in the coordinates in `positions`
 582
 583        Args:
 584            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
 585            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 586            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
 587            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
 588        """
 589        import re 
 590        if number_of_proteins <=0:
 591            return
 592        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 593                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
 594            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
 595
 596        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
 597
 598        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 599        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
 600        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 601        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
 602        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:          
 603            self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
 604            if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
 605                molecule_id = 0        
 606            else:
 607                # check if a residue is part of another molecule
 608                check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
 609                pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
 610                if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == 'protein' :              
 611                    for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
 612                        if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
 613                            molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
 614                            break
 615                else:
 616                    molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
 617
 618            #assigns molecule_id to the protein defined       
 619            self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
 620                                index=int(molecule_index),
 621                                new_value=molecule_id, 
 622                                warning=False)
 623
 624            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
 625                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
 626                                                                        n_samples=1, 
 627                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
 628   
 629            for residue in positions.keys():
 630                residue_name = re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
 631                residue_number = re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
 632                residue_position = positions[residue]['initial_pos']
 633                position = residue_position + protein_center
 634                particle_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=residue_name,
 635                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
 636                                                            number_of_particles=1,
 637                                                            position=[position], 
 638                                                            fix = True)
 639
 640                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
 641
 642                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 643                                            index=int (index),
 644                                            new_value=residue_number)
 645
 646                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 647                                        index=int (index),
 648                                        new_value=molecule_id)
 649                
 650            if molecule_index == min(protein_index_list):
 651                self.setup_particle_diameter(positions=positions)
 652
 653        return
 654
 655    def create_residue_in_espresso (self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
 656        """
 657        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 658
 659        Args:
 660            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 661            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 662            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
 663            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
 664            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
 665            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
 666        Returns:
 667            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 668        """
 669        if number_of_residues <= 0:
 670            return
 671        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 672                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
 673            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
 674        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
 675        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 676                            column_name='residue_id',
 677                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
 678        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 679        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
 680        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
 681        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 682        residues_info={}
 683        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
 684            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
 685            # Assign a residue_id
 686            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
 687                residue_id=0
 688            else:
 689                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
 690            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
 691            # create the principal bead
 692            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
 693                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
 694            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
 695            central_bead_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=central_bead_name,
 696                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 697                                                                position=central_bead_position,
 698                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
 699            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 700            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
 701            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
 702            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
 703            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
 704            residues_info[residue_id]={}
 705            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
 706            # create the lateral beads  
 707            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
 708            side_chain_beads_ids = []
 709            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
 710                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
 711                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
 712                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
 713                if pmb_type == 'particle':
 714                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 715                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 716                            hard_check=True, use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 717                    if backbone_vector is None:
 718                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 719                                                              radius=bond.params.get('r_0'), 
 720                                                            n_samples=1)[0]
 721                    else:
 722                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 723                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
 724                                                                            radius=bond.params.get('r_0'))
 725                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=side_chain_element, 
 726                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
 727                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
 728                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
 729                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
 730                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 731                                        index=int (index),
 732                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 733                                        warning=False)
 734                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
 735                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
 736                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 737                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
 738                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 739                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 740                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
 741                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 742                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 743                                            hard_check=True, 
 744                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 745                    if backbone_vector is None:
 746                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 747                                                                radius=bond.params.get('r_0'), 
 748                                                                n_samples=1)[0]
 749                    else:
 750                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 751                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
 752                                                                                radius=bond.params.get('r_0'))
 753                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
 754                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 755                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
 756                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
 757                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
 758                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
 759                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
 760                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
 761                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 762                                        index=int(index),
 763                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 764                                        warning=False)
 765                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
 766                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
 767                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
 768                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
 769                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 770                                            index=int (index),
 771                                            new_value=residue_id, 
 772                                            warning=False)
 773                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
 774                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 775                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
 776                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 777            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
 778            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
 779        return  residues_info
 780
 781    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
 782        """
 783        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
 784
 785        Args:
 786            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
 787        Returns:
 788            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
 789        """        
 790        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
