 791        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
 792        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
 793
 794        return variable_with_units
 795
 796    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence (self, sequence):
 797        '''
 798        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
 799
 800        Args:
 801            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
 802
 803        Note:
 804            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to aminoacid names using the standard  one letter code.
 805        '''
 806
 807        already_defined_AA=[]
 808        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
 809        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
 810
 811        for residue_name in sequence:
 812            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
 813                continue
 814            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
 815                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
 816            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
 817                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
 818            else:
 819                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
 820        return 
 821
 822    def define_bond(self, bond_object, particle_name1, particle_name2):
 823        """
 824        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
 825        
 826        Args:
 827            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
 828            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
 829            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded..
 830        """    
 831        index = len(self.df)
 832        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
 833            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
 834        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
 835        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
 836        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
 837                                key=('pmb_type',''),
 838                                new_value='bond')
 839        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
 840                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
 841                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
 842        return
 843
 844    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object):
 845        """
 846        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
 847
 848        Args:
 849            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
 850        """
 851        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
 852            return
 853        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
 854            index = max(self.df.index)+1
 855        else:
 856            index = 0
 857        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
 858        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
 859        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
 860                            key=('pmb_type',''),
 861                            new_value='bond')
 862        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
 863                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
 864                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
 865        return
 866
 867    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles (self, eps_dict):
 868        '''
 869        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
 870
 871        Args:
 872            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
 873        '''
 874        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
 875            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
 876            for index in label_list:
 877                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
 878                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
 879                        index=int (index),
 880                        new_value=epsilon)
 881        return 
 882
 883
 884    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
 885        """
 886        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
 887
 888        Args:
 889            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
 890            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
 891        """
 892        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
 893            return
 894        index = len(self.df)
 895        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
 896        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
 897        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
 898        return
 899
 900    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
 901        """
 902        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in  `pymbe.df`
 903
 904        Args:
 905            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
 906            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
 907            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
 908            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
 909            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
 910            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
 911        """ 
 912        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
 913            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
 914        else:
 915            index = len(self.df)
 916            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
 917            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
 918            
 919        if diameter:
 920            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
 921        if epsilon:
 922            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
 923        
 924        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
 925        return 
 926
 927    def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model):
 928        """
 929        Defines a pyMBE object of type `peptide` in the `pymbe.df`.
 930
 931        Args:
 932            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `peptide`.
 933            sequence (`string`): Sequence of the `peptide`.
 934            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per aminoacid are supported.
 935        """
 936        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name = name, pmb_type_to_be_defined='peptide'):
 937            valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
 938            if model not in valid_keys:
 939                raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
 940            clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=sequence)
 941            residue_list = []
 942            for residue_name in clean_sequence:
 943                if model == '1beadAA':
 944                    central_bead = residue_name
 945                    side_chains = []
 946                elif model == '2beadAA':
 947                    # terminal groups + glycine are represented with only 1 bead
 948                    if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
 949                        central_bead = residue_name
 950                        side_chains = []
 951                    else:
 952                        central_bead = 'CA'
 953                        side_chains = [residue_name]
 954                if residue_name not in residue_list: 
 955                    self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
 956                                        central_bead = central_bead,
 957                                        side_chains = side_chains)
 958                residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
 959            self.define_molecule(name = name, residue_list=residue_list)
 960            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == name].index.item() 
 961            self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
 962            self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence
 963        return
 964    
 965    def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains):
 966        """
 967        Defines a pyMBE object of type `residue` in `pymbe.df`.
 968
 969        Args:
 970            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `residue`.
 971            central_bead (`str`): `name` of the `particle` to be placed as central_bead of the `residue`.
 972            side_chains (`list` of `str`): List of `name`s of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the `residue`. Currently, only pmb_objects of type `particle`s or `residue`s are supported.
 973        """
 974        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
 975            return
 976        index = len(self.df)
 977        self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
 978        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'residue'
 979        self.df.at [index,'central_bead'] = central_bead
 980        self.df.at [index,('side_chains','')] = side_chains
 981        return 
 982
 983    def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system):
 984        """
 985        Destroys all particles associated with `name` in `espresso_system` amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from `pmb.df` 
 986
 987        Args:
 988            name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in `pymbe.df`.
 989            espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
 990
 991        Note:
 992            - If `name`  is a object_type=`particle`, only the mathcing particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. `residue`, `molecule`) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
 993        """
 994        allowed_objects = ['particle','residue','molecule']
 995        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 996        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 997            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 998        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 999            particles_index = self.df.index[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna()) 
1000                                                  & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())]
1001            particle_ids_list= self.df.loc[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna())
1002                                                 & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())].particle_id.tolist()
1003            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1004                espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1005            self.df = self.df.drop(index=particles_index)
1006        if pmb_type == 'residue':
1007            residues_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].residue_id.to_list()
1008            for residue_id in residues_id:
1009                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1010                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['residue_id'] == residue_id].index)
1011                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1012                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1013                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)    
1014        if pmb_type == 'molecule':
1015            molecules_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].molecule_id.to_list()
1016            for molecule_id in molecules_id:
1017                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1018                
1019                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['molecule_id'] == molecule_id].index)
1020                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1021                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()   
1022                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)             
1023        
1024        self.df.reset_index(drop=True,inplace=True)
1025
1026        return
1027
1028    def filter_df (self, pmb_type):
1029        """
1030        Filters `pmb.df` and returns a sub-set of it containing only rows with pmb_object_type=`pmb_type` and non-Nan columns.
1031        
1032        Args:
1033            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to filter in `pmb.df`.
1034        Returns:
1035            pmb_type_df(`obj`): filtered `pmb.df`.
1036        """
1037        pmb_type_df = self.df.loc[self.df['pmb_type']== pmb_type]
1038        pmb_type_df = pmb_type_df.dropna( axis=1, thresh=1)
1039        return pmb_type_df
1040
1041    def find_bond_key(self,particle_name1, particle_name2, use_default_bond=False):
1042        """
1043        Searches for the `name`  of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1044        
1045        Args:
1046            particle_name1(`str`): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1047            particle_name2(`str`): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1048            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to 'False'. 
1049
1050        Returns:
1051            bond_key (str): `name` of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` 
1052
1053        Note:
1054            - If `use_default_bond`=`True`, it returns "default" if no key is found.
1055        """
1056        bond_keys = [particle_name1 +'-'+ particle_name2, particle_name2 +'-'+ particle_name1 ]
1057        bond_defined=False
1058        for bond_key in bond_keys:
1059            if bond_key in self.df.values:
1060                bond_defined=True
1061                correct_key=bond_key
1062                break
1063        if bond_defined:
1064            return correct_key
1065        elif use_default_bond:
1066            return 'default'
1067        else:
1068            return 
1069
1070    def find_value_from_es_type(self, es_type, column_name):
1071        """
1072        Finds a value in `pmb.df` for a `column_name` and `es_type` pair.
1073
1074        Args:
1075            es_type(`int`): value of the espresso type
1076            column_name(`str`): name of the column in `pymbe.df`
1077
1078        Returns:
1079            Value in `pymbe.df` matching  `column_name` and `es_type`
1080        """
1081        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
1082        for state in ['state_one', 'state_two']:
1083            index = self.np.where(self.df[(state, 'es_type')] == es_type)[0]
1084            
1085            if len(index) > 0:
1086                if column_name == 'label':
1087                    label = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(state,column_name)]]
1088                    return label
1089                else: 
1090                    column_name_value = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(column_name,'')]]
1091                    return column_name_value
1092        return None
1093
1094    def generate_coordinates_outside_sphere (self, center, radius, max_dist, n_samples):
1095
1096        """
1097        Generates coordinates outside a sphere centered.
1098
1099        Args:
1100            center(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of the sphere.
1101            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1102            max_dist(`float`): Maximum distance from the center of the spahre to generate coordinates.
1103            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points.
1104
1105        Returns:
1106            coord_list(`lst`): Coordinates of the sample points.
1107        """
1108        if not radius > 0: 
1109            raise ValueError (f'The value of {radius} must be a positive value')
1110        if not radius < max_dist:
1111            raise ValueError(f'The min_dist ({radius} must be lower than the max_dist ({max_dist}))')
1112        coord_list = []
1113        for _ in range(n_samples):
1114            rand = self.np.random.random() 
1115            rad = radius + rand*(max_dist-radius)
1116            coord = self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=rad,n_samples=1)[0]
1117            coord_list.append (coord)
1118        return coord_list
1119
1120    def generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(self, vector, center, radius):
1121        """
1122        Generates a random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1123        
1124        Args:
1125            vector(`lst`): Coordinates of the vector.
1126            magnitude(`float`): magnitude of the vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1127
1128        Returns:
1129            perpendicular_vector(`np.array`): random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1130        """
1131        np_vec=self.np.array(vector)
1132        if np_vec[1] == 0 and np_vec[2] == 0 and np_vec[0] == 1:
1133            raise ValueError('zero vector')
1134        perp_vec = self.np.cross(np_vec, self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=radius, n_samples=1)[0])
1135        norm_perp_vec = perp_vec/self.np.linalg.norm(perp_vec)
1136        return center+norm_perp_vec*radius  
1137    
1138    def generate_trialvectors (self,center, radius, n_samples, seed=None):
1139        """
1140        Uniformly samples points from a hypersphere.
1141        
1142        Args:
1143            center(`lst`): Array with the coordinates of the center of the spheres.
1144            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1145            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points to generate inside the sphere.
1146            seed (`int`, optional): Seed for the random number generator
1147
1148        Returns:
1149            samples(`list`): Coordinates of the sample points inside the hypersphere.
1150
1151        Note:
1152            - Algorithm from: https://baezortega.github.io/2018/10/14/hypersphere-sampling/
1153        """
1154        # initial values
1155        center=self.np.array(center)
1156        d = center.shape[0]
1157        # sample n_samples points in d dimensions from a standard normal distribution
1158        rng = self.np.random.default_rng(seed)
1159        samples = rng.normal(size=(n_samples, d))
1160        # make the samples lie on the surface of the unit hypersphere
1161        normalize_radii = self.np.linalg.norm(samples, axis=1)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1162        samples /= normalize_radii
1163        # make the samples lie inside the hypersphere with the correct density
1164        uniform_points = rng.uniform(size=n_samples)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1165        new_radii = self.np.power(uniform_points, 1/d)
1166        samples *= new_radii
1167        # scale the points to have the correct radius and center
1168        samples = samples * radius + center
1169        return samples 
1170
1171    def get_charge_map (self):
1172        '''
1173        Gets the charge of each `espresso_type` in `pymbe.df`.
1174        
1175        Returns:
1176            charge_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: charge}.
1177        '''
1178        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1179            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna()     
1180            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()  
1181        else:    
1182            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1183            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1184                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()   
1185            else:
1186                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1187        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.charge.values,index=df_state_one.es_type.values)
1188        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.charge.values,index=df_state_two.es_type.values)
1189        charge_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1190        return charge_map
1191
1192    def get_pka_set(self):
1193        '''
1194        Gets the pka-values and acidities of the particles with acid/base properties in `pmb.df`
1195        
1196        Returns:
1197            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
1198        '''
1199        titratables_AA_df = self.df[[('name',''),('pka',''),('acidity','')]].drop_duplicates().dropna()
1200        pka_set = {}
1201        for index in titratables_AA_df.name.keys():
1202            name = titratables_AA_df.name[index]
1203            pka_value = titratables_AA_df.pka[index]
1204            acidity = titratables_AA_df.acidity[index]   
1205            pka_set[name] = {'pka_value':pka_value,'acidity':acidity}
1206        return pka_set 
1207    
1208    def get_radius_map(self):
1209        '''
1210        Gets the diameter of each `espresso type` in `pmb.df`. 
1211        
1212        Returns:
1213            radius_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: radius}.
1214
1215        '''
1216
1217        df_state_one = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_one','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1218        df_state_two = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_two','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1219
1220        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_one.state_one.es_type.values)
1221        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_two.state_two.es_type.values)
1222        radius_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1223        
1224        return radius_map
1225
1226    def get_type_map(self):
1227        """
1228        Gets all different espresso types assigned to particles  in `pmb.df`.
1229        
1230        Returns:
1231            type_map(`dict`): {"name": espresso_type}.
1232        """
1233        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1234            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna(how='all')     
1235            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')  
1236        else:    
1237            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1238            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1239                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')   
1240            else:
1241                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1242        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.es_type.values,index=df_state_one.label)
1243        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.es_type.values,index=df_state_two.label)
1244        type_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1245        return type_map
1246
1247    def load_interaction_parameters (self, filename, verbose=False):
1248        """
1249        Loads the interaction parameters stored in filename into `pmb.df`
1250        
1251        Args:
1252            filename(`str`): name of the file to be read
1253            verbose(`bool`): switches on/off the reading prints
1254        """
1255        from espressomd import interactions
1256        without_units = ['q','es_type','acidity']
1257        with_units = ['diameter','epsilon']
1258        with open(filename) as f:
1259            for line in f:
1260                if line[0] == '#':
1261                    continue
1262                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1263                object_type=param_dict['object_type']
1264                if object_type == 'particle':
1265                    not_requiered_attributes={}    
1266                    for not_requiered_key in without_units+with_units:
1267                        if not_requiered_key in param_dict.keys():
1268                            if not_requiered_key in with_units:
1269                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key))
1270                            elif not_requiered_key in without_units:
1271                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key)
1272                        else:
1273                            if not_requiered_key == 'acidity':
1274                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key] = 'inert'
1275                            else:    
1276                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=None
1277                    self.define_particle(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1278                                    q=not_requiered_attributes.pop('q'),
1279                                    diameter=not_requiered_attributes.pop('diameter'),
1280                                    acidity=not_requiered_attributes.pop('acidity'),
1281                                    epsilon=not_requiered_attributes.pop('epsilon'))
1282                elif object_type == 'residue':
1283                    self.define_residue (name = param_dict.pop('name'),
1284                                        central_bead = param_dict.pop('central_bead_name'),
1285                                        side_chains = param_dict.pop('side_chains_names'))
1286                elif object_type == 'molecule':
1287                    self.define_molecule(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1288                                        residue_list=param_dict.pop('residue_name_list'))
1289                elif object_type == 'peptide':
1290                    self.define_peptide(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1291                                        sequence=param_dict.pop('sequence'),
1292                                        model=param_dict.pop('model'))
1293                elif object_type == 'bond':
1294                    name1 = param_dict.pop('name1')
1295                    name2 = param_dict.pop('name2')
1296                    bond_type = param_dict.pop('bond_type')
1297                    if bond_type == 'harmonic':
1298                        k = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('k'))
1299                        r_0 = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('r_0'))
1300                        bond = interactions.HarmonicBond(k=k.to('reduced_energy / reduced_length**2').magnitude, r_0=r_0.to('reduced_length').magnitude)
1301                    else:
1302                        raise ValueError("current implementation of pyMBE only supports harmonic bonds")
1303                    self.define_bond(bond_object=bond, particle_name1=name1, particle_name2=name2)
1304                else:
1305                    raise ValueError(object_type+' is not a known pmb object type')
1306                if verbose:
1307                    print('Added: '+line)
1308        return
1309
1310    
1311    
1312    def load_pka_set(self,filename, verbose=False):
1313        """
1314        Loads the pka_set stored in `filename` into `pmb.df`.
1315        
1316        Args:
1317            filename(`str`): name of the file with the pka set to be loaded. Expected format is {name:{"acidity": acidity, "pka_value":pka_value}}.
1318            verbose(`bool`, optional): If activated, the function reports each pKa value loaded. Defaults to False
1319
1320        Note:
1321            - If `name` is already defined in the `pymbe.df`, it prints a warning.
1322        """
1323        pKa_list=[]
1324        with open(filename) as f:
1325            for line in f:
1326                if line[0] == '#':
1327                    continue
1328                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1329                pKa_list.append(param_dict)    
1330                if verbose:
1331                    print('Added: '+line)
1332        for pka_set in pKa_list:            
1333            self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1334            for pka_key in pka_set: 
1335                acidity =   pka_set[pka_key]['acidity']        
1336                pka_value = pka_set[pka_key]['pka_value']     
1337                self.define_particle(name=pka_key,acidity=acidity, pka=pka_value)
1338        return
1339
1340    def load_protein_vtf_in_df (self, name, filename,unit_length=None):
1341        """
1342        Loads a coarse-grained protein model in a vtf file `filename` into the `pmb.df` and it labels it with `name`.
1343
1344        Args:
1345            name(`str`): Unique label to identify the protein.
1346            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file with the coarse-grained model.
1347            unit_length(`obj`): unit of lenght of the the coordinates in `filename` using the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1348
1349        Returns:
1350            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1351
1352        Note:
1353            - If no `unit_length` is provided, it is assumed that the coordinates are in Angstrom.
1354        """
1355
1356        print (f'Loading protein coarse grain model file: {filename}')
1357
1358        protein_seq_list = []
1359        coord_list = []
1360
1361        label_dict = {}
1362        label_CA = False 
1363
1364        if unit_length == None:
1365            unit_length = 1 * self.units.angstrom 
1366
1367        with open (filename,'r') as protein_model:
1368
1369                for line in protein_model :
1370                    line_split = line.split ()
1371    
1372                    if line_split : 
1373                        line_header = line_split [0]
1374
1375                        if line_header == 'unitcell':    
1376                            box = line_split[1:4]
1377
1378                        elif line_header == 'atom':
1379
1380                            atom_id  = line_split [1]
1381                            atom_name = line_split [3]
1382                            atom_resname = line_split [5]
1383                            chain_id = line_split [7]
1384                            atom_radius = line_split [9]
1385
1386                            diameter = ((float(atom_radius)*2.0)*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1387
1388                            label_dict [int(atom_id)] = [atom_name , atom_resname, chain_id, diameter]
1389
1390                            if atom_name == 'CA' or label_CA == True:
1391                                label_CA = True
1392
1393                            if atom_name != 'CA' and atom_name != 'Ca':
1394                                protein_seq_list.append(atom_name)                        
1395
1396                        elif line_header == 'bond' :
1397                            atom_bond = line_split [1] 
1398
1399                        elif line_header.isnumeric (): 
1400                            particle_id = line_split [0]
1401                            particle_coord = line_split [1:] 
1402                            particle_coord = [float(i) for i in particle_coord]
1403
1404                            coord_list.append (particle_coord)
1405
1406        axes_list = [0,1,2]
1407        updated_coordinates_list = []
1408
1409        # Pablo-NOTE:
1410        # 1- Lines 1397-1403 could be done before in line 1389
1411        # 2- Definir el diametro del CA
1412        # 3- Cambiar load_protein_vtf_in_df por read_protein_vtf --> topology_dict
1413        # 4- Nueva funcion define_protein ()
1414        # 5- Tener cuidado con label_CA
1415        # 6- Limpiar codigo, borrar variables e condiciones innecesarias
1416        # 7- Hacer funciones de las lineas repetidas de codigo entre create_molecule y create_protein (las que hacen copias en el df)
1417
1418        for pos in coord_list:
1419            updated_pos = self.np.zeros(3,)
1420            for axis in axes_list:
1421                updated_pos[axis] = (pos[axis]*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1422            updated_coordinates_list.append (updated_pos.tolist())
1423
1424        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1425
1426        print (f'Protein Sequence: {protein_sequence}')
1427
1428        numbered_resname = []
1429        i = 0   
1430        
1431        for atom_id in label_dict.keys():
1432    
1433            if atom_id == 1:
1434                atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1435                updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1436                numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1437
1438            elif atom_id != 1: 
1439            
1440                if label_dict[atom_id-1][1] != label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1441                    i += 1                    
1442                    count = 1
1443                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1444                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1445                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1446                    
1447                elif label_dict[atom_id-1][1] == label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1448                    if count == 2 or label_dict[atom_id][1] == 'GLY':
1449                        i +=1  
1450                        count = 0
1451                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1452                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1453                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1454                    count +=1
1455
1456        topology_dict = {}
1457
1458        for i in range (0, len(numbered_resname)):   
1459            topology_dict [numbered_resname[i][0]] = {'initial_pos': updated_coordinates_list[i] ,'chain_id':numbered_resname[i][1], 'diameter':numbered_resname[i][2] }
1460
1461        #### CORTAR
1462
1463        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1464
1465        index = len(self.df)
1466        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1467        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1468        self.df.at [index,'model'] = '2beadAA' 
1469
1470        if label_CA:
1471            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1472
1473        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1474
1475        residue_list = []
1476
1477        for residue_name in clean_sequence:
1478
1479            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1480
1481                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1482                    central_bead = residue_name
1483                    side_chains = []
1484                else:
1485                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1486                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1487
1488                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1489                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1490                                    side_chains = side_chains)
1491            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1492
1493        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = protein_sequence  
1494        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1495
1496        return topology_dict
1497
1498    def print_reduced_units(self):
1499        """
1500        Prints the  current set of reduced units defined in pyMBE.units.
1501        """
1502        print("\nCurrent set of reduced units:")
1503        unit_length=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_length')
1504        unit_energy=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_energy')
1505        unit_charge=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_charge')
1506        print(unit_length.to('nm'), "=", unit_length)
1507        print(unit_energy.to('J'), "=", unit_energy)
1508        print('Temperature:', (self.kT/self.Kb).to("K"))
1509        print(unit_charge.to('C'), "=", unit_charge)
1510        print()
1511
1512    def propose_unused_type(self):
1513        """
1514        Searches in `pmb.df` all the different particle types defined and returns a new one.
1515
1516        Returns:
1517            unused_type(`int`): unused particle type
1518        """
1519        type_map=self.get_type_map()
1520        if type_map == {}:    
1521            unused_type = 0
1522        else:
1523            unused_type=max(type_map.values())+1    
1524        return unused_type
1525
1526    def protein_sequence_parser(self, sequence):
1527        '''
1528        Parses `sequence` to the one letter code for aminoacids.
1529        
1530        Args:
1531            sequence(`str` or `lst`): Sequence of the aminoacid. 
1532
1533        Returns:
1534            clean_sequence(`list`): `sequence` using the one letter code.
1535        
1536        Note:
1537            - Accepted formats for `sequence` are:
1538                - `lst` with one letter or three letter code of each aminoacid in each element
1539                - `str` with the sequence using the one letter code
1540                - `str` with the squence using the three letter code, each aminoacid must be separated by a hyphon "-"
1541        
1542        '''
1543        # Aminoacid key
1544        keys={"ALA": "A",
1545                "ARG": "R",
1546                "ASN": "N",
1547                "ASP": "D",
1548                "CYS": "C",
1549                "GLU": "E",
1550                "GLN": "Q",
1551                "GLY": "G",
1552                "HIS": "H",
1553                "ILE": "I",
1554                "LEU": "L",
1555                "LYS": "K",
1556                "MET": "M",
1557                "PHE": "F",
1558                "PRO": "P",
1559                "SER": "S",
1560                "THR": "T",
1561                "TRP": "W",
1562                "TYR": "Y",
1563                "VAL": "V",
1564                "PSER": "J",
1565                "PTHR": "U",
1566                "PTyr": "Z",
1567                "NH2": "n",
1568                "COOH": "c"}
1569        clean_sequence=[]
1570        if isinstance(sequence, str):
1571            if (sequence.find("-") != -1):
1572                splited_sequence=sequence.split("-")
1573                for residue in splited_sequence:
1574                    if len(residue) == 1:
1575                        if residue in keys.values():
1576                            residue_ok=residue
1577                        else:
1578                            if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1579                                residue_ok=residue.upper()
1580                            else:
1581                                raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue given: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1582                        clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1583                    else:
1584                        if residue in keys.keys():
1585                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue])
1586                        else:
1587                            if (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1588                                clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1589                            else:
1590                                raise ValueError("Unknown  code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1591            else:
1592                for residue in sequence:
1593                    if residue in keys.values():
1594                        residue_ok=residue
1595                    else:
1596                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1597                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1598                        else:
1599                            raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1600                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1601        if isinstance(sequence, list):
1602            for residue in sequence:
1603                    if residue in keys.values():
1604                        residue_ok=residue
1605                    else:
1606                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1607                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1608                        elif (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1609                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1610                        else:
1611                            raise ValueError("Unknown code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1612                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1613        return clean_sequence
1614
1615    def search_bond (self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False) :
1616        """
1617        Searches for bonds between the particle types given by `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1618        If `use_default_bond` is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns that default bond instead.
1619        If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return nothing. If `hard_check` is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.
1620
1621        Args:
1622            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1623            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1624            hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False. 
1625            use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to False. 
1626
1627        Returns:
1628            bond (cls): bond object from the espressomd library.
1629        
1630        Note:
1631            - If `use_default_bond`=True and no bond is defined between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`, it returns the default bond defined in `pmb.df`.
1632            - If `hard_check`=`True` stops the code when no bond is found.
1633        """
1634        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1635                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1636                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
1637        if bond_key:
1638            return self.df[self.df['name']==bond_key].bond_object.values[0]
1639        else:
1640            print("Bond not defined between particles ", particle_name1, " and ", particle_name2)    
1641            if hard_check:
1642                exit()
1643            else:
1644                return
1645
1646    def set_particle_acidity(self, name, acidity='inert', default_charge=0, pka=None):
1647        """
1648        Sets the particle acidity if its acidic or basic creates `state_one` and `state_two` with the protonated and 
1649        deprotonated states. In each state is set: `label`,`charge` and `es_type`. If its inert it will define only `state_one`
1650
1651        Args:
1652            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`. 
1653            acidity (`str`): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1654            default_charge (`int`): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
1655            pka (`float`, optional):  If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1656        """
1657        acidity_valid_keys = ['inert','acidic', 'basic']
1658        if acidity not in acidity_valid_keys:
1659            raise ValueError(self.df[name].name +' provided acidity not supported, valid keys are ', acidity_valid_keys)   
1660        for index in self.df[self.df['name']==name].index:       
1661            if pka:
1662                self.add_value_to_df(key=('pka',''),index=index,new_value=pka)
1663            self.add_value_to_df(key=('acidity',''),index=index,new_value=acidity) 
1664            if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_one','es_type')):
1665                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())  
1666            if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'inert':
1667                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=default_charge)
1668                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1669            else:
1670                protonated_label = f'{name}H'
1671                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=protonated_label)
1672                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1673                if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_two','es_type')):
1674                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())
1675                if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'acidic':        
1676                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)
1677                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=-1)
1678                elif self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'basic':
1679                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=+1)
1680                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)   
1681        return
1682
1683    
1684    
1685    def set_reduced_units(self, unit_length=None,unit_charge=None,temperature=None):
1686        """
1687        Sets the set of reduced units used by pyMBE.units and it prints it.
1688
1689        Args:
1690            unit_length (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of length defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1691            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1692            temperature (`obj`,optional): Temperature of the system, defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1693
1694        Note:
1695            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
1696            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
1697            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
1698        """
1699        self.units=self.pint.UnitRegistry()
1700        if unit_length is None:
1701            unit_length=0.355*self.units.nm
1702        if temperature is None:
1703            temperature=298.15 * self.units.K
1704        if unit_charge is None:
1705            unit_charge=self.units.e
1706        self.N_A=6.02214076e23 / self.units.mol
1707        self.Kb=1.38064852e-23 * self.units.J / self.units.K
1708        self.e=1.60217662e-19 *self.units.C
1709        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
1710        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT} ')
1711        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
1712        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = {unit_charge}')        
1713        self.print_reduced_units()
1714        return
1715
1716    def setup_constantpH_reactions_in_espresso(self, counter_ion, constant_pH, SEED, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
1717        """
1718        Sets up the Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic `particles` defined in `pmb.df` to be sampled in the constant pH ensamble. 
1719
1720        Args:
1721            counter_ion(`str`): `name` of the counter_ion `particle`.
1722            constant_pH(`float`): pH-value.
1723            SEED(`int`): Seed for the random number generator.
1724            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): Bellow this value, no particles will be inserted.
1725            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius per each espresso_type. Defaults to `False`.
1726            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
1727        Returns:
1728            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ConstantpHEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
1729            sucessfull_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
1730        """
1731        from espressomd import reaction_methods
1732        if exclusion_range is None:
1733            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
1734        if pka_set is None:
1735            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
1736        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1737        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
1738            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
1739        else:
1740            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
1741        
1742        RE = reaction_methods.ConstantpHEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
1743                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
1744                                                    seed=SEED, 
1745                                                    constant_pH=constant_pH,
1746                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
1747                                                    )
1748        sucessfull_reactions_labels=[]
1749        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
1750        for name in pka_set.keys():
1751            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
1752                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in sg.type_map')
1753                continue
1754            gamma=10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value']
1755            state_one_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1756            state_two_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
1757            counter_ion_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==counter_ion].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1758            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma,
1759                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
1760                            product_types=[state_two_type, counter_ion_type],
1761                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
1762                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
1763                            counter_ion_type: charge_map[counter_ion_type]})
1764            sucessfull_reactions_labels.append(name)
1765        return RE, sucessfull_reactions_labels
1766
1767    def setup_df (self):
1768        """
1769        Sets up the pyMBE's dataframe `pymbe.df`
1770        """
1771
1772        columns_name = self.pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples ([
1773                        ('name',''),
1774                        ('pmb_type',''),
1775                        ('particle_id',''), 
1776                        ('particle_id2',''),
1777                        ('residue_id',''),
1778                        ('molecule_id',''),
1779                        ('acidity',''),
1780                        ('pka',''),
1781                        ('central_bead',''),
1782                        ('side_chains',''),
1783                        ('residue_list',''),
1784                        ('model',''),
1785                        ('diameter',''),
1786                        ('epsilon',''),
1787                        ('state_one','label'),
1788                        ('state_one','es_type'),
1789                        ('state_one','charge'),
1790                        ('state_two','label'),
1791                        ('state_two','es_type'),
1792                        ('state_two','charge'),
1793                        ('sequence',''),
1794                        ('bond_object',''),
1795                        ('parameters_of_the_potential','')
1796                        ])
1797
1798        self.df = self.pd.DataFrame (columns = columns_name)
1799      
1800        return 
1801
1802
1803    def setup_lj_interactions_in_espresso (self, espresso_system, cutoff=None, shift='auto', combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'):
1804        """
1805        Sets up the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential between all pairs of particle types with values for `diameter` and `epsilon` stored in `pymbe.df`.
1806        Stores the parameters loaded into  ESPResSo for each type pair in `pymbe.df`.
1807        Assumes that the LJ interactions between all particles will have the same `cutoff`, `shift` and `combining_rule`.
1808        Check the documentation of ESPResSo for more info about the potential https://espressomd.github.io/doc4.2.0/inter_non-bonded.html
1809
1810        Args:
1811            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1812            cutoff(`float`, optional): cut-off length of the LJ potential. Defaults to None.
1813            shift (`string`, optional): If set to `auto` shifts the potential to be continous at `cutoff`. Defaults to `auto`.
1814            combining_rule (`string`, optional): combining rule used to calculate `sigma` and `epsilon` for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
1815
1816        Note:
1817            - If no `cutoff`  is given, its value is set to 2**(1./6.) in reduced_lenght units, corresponding to a purely steric potential.
1818            - Currently, the only `combining_rule` supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
1819        """
1820        from itertools import combinations_with_replacement
1821        sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1822        implemented_combinatiorial_rules = ['Lorentz-Berthelot']
1823        compulsory_parameters_in_df = ['diameter','epsilon']
1824        if combining_rule not in implemented_combinatiorial_rules:
1825            raise ValueError('In the current version of pyMBE, the only combinatorial rules implemented are ', implemented_combinatiorial_rules)
1826        if cutoff is None:
1827            cutoff=2**(1./6.)*self.units('reduced_length')
1828        particles_types_with_LJ_parameters = []
1829        particles_types_without_LJ_parameters= []
1830        for particle_type in self.get_type_map().values():
1831            check_list=[]
1832            for key in compulsory_parameters_in_df:
1833                value_in_df=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle_type,
1834                                                        column_name=key)
1835                check_list.append(self.np.isnan(value_in_df))
1836            if any(check_list):
1837                particles_types_without_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1838            else:
1839                particles_types_with_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1840        for type_pair in combinations_with_replacement(particles_types_with_LJ_parameters, 2):
1841            pair_parameters={}
1842            for ptype in type_pair:
1843                pair_parameters[ptype]={}
1844                pair_parameters[ptype]["label"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='label')
1845                pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='diameter')
1846                pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='epsilon')
1847            if combining_rule == 'Lorentz-Berthelot':
1848                combined_sigma=0
1849                epsilon=1
1850                for ptype in type_pair:
1851                    combined_sigma+=pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]
1852                    epsilon*=pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]
1853                offset=combined_sigma/2.-sigma
1854                epsilon=self.np.sqrt(epsilon)
1855            else:
1856                raise ValueError('Undefined combination rule, please report this bug to the developers')
1857            espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0],type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.set_params(epsilon = epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude, 
1858                                                                                    sigma = sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1859                                                                                    cutoff = cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude,
1860                                                                                    offset = offset.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1861                                                                                    shift = shift)                                                                                          
1862            index = len(self.df)
1863            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = f'LJ: {pair_parameters[type_pair[0]]["label"]}-{pair_parameters[type_pair[1]]["label"]}'
1864            lj_params=espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0], type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.get_params()
1865            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1866                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1867                                new_value='LennardJones')
1868            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1869                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1870                                new_value=self.json.dumps(lj_params))                
1871        if particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1872            non_parametrized_labels=[]
1873            for ptype in particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1874                non_parametrized_labels.append(self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, 
1875                                                                            column_name='label')) 
1876            print('WARNING: missing LJ parameters for the following particle labels:')
1877            print(non_parametrized_labels)
1878            print('no interaction has been added for those particles in ESPResSo')
1879        return
1880
1881    def setup_particle_diameter (self,topology_dict):
1882        '''
1883        Sets up the diameter of the particles in `positions`.
1884
1885        Args:
1886            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1887        '''
1888        import re 
1889   
1890        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1891            residue_name = re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1892            residue_number = re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
1893            residue_diameter  = topology_dict[residue]['diameter']
1894            diameter = residue_diameter*self.units.nm
1895            index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_number) & (self.df['name']==residue_name) ].index.values[0]
1896            self.add_value_to_df(key= ('diameter',''),
1897                        index=int (index),
1898                        new_value=diameter)
1899            
1900        return 
1901
1902    def write_output_vtf_file (self, espresso_system, filename):
1903        '''
1904        Writes a snapshot of `espresso_system` on the vtf file `filename`.
1905
1906        Args:
1907            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1908            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file.
1909
1910        '''
1911        box = espresso_system.box_l[0]
1912        with open(filename, mode='w+t') as coordinates:
1913            coordinates.write (f'unitcell {box} {box} {box} \n')
1914            for particle in espresso_system.part: 
1915                type_label = self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle.type, column_name='label')
1916                coordinates.write (f'atom {particle.id} radius 1 name {type_label} type {type_label}\n' )
1917            coordinates.write (f'timestep indexed\n')
1918            for particle in espresso_system.part:
1919                coordinates.write (f'{particle.id} \t {particle.pos[0]} \t {particle.pos[1]} \t {particle.pos[2]}\n')
1920        return

The library for the Molecular Brewer for ESPResSo (pyMBE)

Attributes:
  • N_A(obj): Avogadro number using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • Kb(obj): Boltzmann constant using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • e(obj): Elemental charge using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • df(obj): PandasDataframe used to bookkeep all the information stored in pyMBE. Typically refered as pmb.df.
  • kT(obj): Thermal energy using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. it is used as the unit of reduced energy.
pymbe_library(temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None) 
24    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
25        """
26        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
27        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkepping.
28
29        Args:
30            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
31            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
32            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
33        
34        Note:
35            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
36            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
37            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
38        """
39        # Default definitions of reduced units
40        if temperature is None:
41            temperature= 298.15 * self.units.K
42        if unit_length is None:
43            unit_length= 0.355 * self.units.nm
44        if unit_charge is None:
45            unit_charge=self.units.e
46        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
47        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT}')
48        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
49        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = 1*e')
50        self.setup_df()
51        return

Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with temperature and reduced_length and sets up the pmb.df for bookkepping.

Arguments:
  • temperature(obj,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • unit_length(obj, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • unit_charge (obj,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
Note:
  • If no temperature is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  • If no unit_length is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  • If no unit_charge is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default.
def activate_motion_of_rigid_object(self, name, espresso_system): 
53    def activate_motion_of_rigid_object (self, name, espresso_system):
54        '''
55        Activates the motion of the rigid object `name` in the `espresso_system`.
56
57        Args:
58            name(`str`): Label of the object.
59            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
60
61        Note:
62            - It requires that espressodmd has the following feautures activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
63        '''
64        print ('activate_motion_of_rigid_object requires that espressodmd has the following feautures activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"]')
65        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
66        if pmb_type != 'protein':
67            raise ValueError (f'The pmb_type: {pmb_type} is not currently supported. The supported pmb_type is: protein')
68        molecule_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].molecule_id.to_list()
69        for molecule_id in molecule_ids_list:    
70            particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
71            center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
72            rigid_object_center = espresso_system.part.add(pos=center_of_mass,
73                                                           rotation=[True,True,True], 
74                                                           type=self.propose_unused_type())
75            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
76                pid = espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id)
77                pid.vs_auto_relate_to(rigid_object_center.id)
78        return

Activates the motion of the rigid object name in the espresso_system.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the object.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
Note:
  • It requires that espressodmd has the following feautures activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
def add_bond_in_df(self, particle_id1, particle_id2, use_default_bond=False): 
 80    def add_bond_in_df (self,particle_id1,particle_id2, use_default_bond=False):
 81        """
 82        Adds a bond entry on the `pymbe.df` storing the particle_ids of the two bonded.
 83
 84        Args:
 85            particle_id1 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
 86            particle_id2 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
 87            use_default_bond (`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`. Defaults to False.
 88        """
 89        particle_name1 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id1].name.values[0]
 90        particle_name2 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id2].name.values[0]
 91        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1,
 92                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
 93                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 94        if not bond_key:
 95            return
 96        self.copy_df_entry(name=bond_key,column_name='particle_id2',number_of_copies=1)
 97        indexs = self.np.where(self.df['name']==bond_key)
 98        index_list = list (indexs[0])
 99        used_bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id2'].notnull()]
100        #without this drop the program crashes when dropping duplicates because the 'bond' column is a dict
101        used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop([('bond_object','')],axis =1 )
102        if len(used_bond_df.index) > 1: 
103            used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')
104        used_bond_index = used_bond_df.index.to_list()
105        for index in index_list:
106            if index not in used_bond_index:
107                self.clean_df_row(index=int(index))
108                self.df.at[index,'particle_id'] = particle_id1
109                self.df.at[index,'particle_id2'] = particle_id2
110                break
111        return

Adds a bond entry on the pymbe.df storing the particle_ids of the two bonded.

Arguments:
  • particle_id1 (int): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  • particle_id2 (int): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  • use_default_bond (bool, optional): Controls if a bond of type default is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in pmb.df. Defaults to False.
def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system): 
113    def add_bonds_to_espresso (self, espresso_system) :
114        """
115        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
116
117        Args:
118            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
119        """
120
121        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
122            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
123            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
124            for bond in bond_list:
125                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
126        else:
127            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
128        
129        return

Adds all bonds defined in pmb.df to espresso_system.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
def add_value_to_df(self, index, key, new_value, warning=True): 
131    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
132        """
133        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
134
135        Args:
136
137            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
138            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
139            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
140        """
141        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
142        index = int (index)
143        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
144        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
145        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
146            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
147            if warning:
148                if old_value != new_value:
149                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
150                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
151                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
152                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
153        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
154        return

Adds a value to a cell in the pmb.df DataFrame.

Arguments:
  • index(int): index of the row to add the value to.
  • key(str): the column label to add the value to.
  • warning(bool, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in pmb.df. Defaults to true.
def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system): 
156    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule (self,molecule_id, espresso_system):
157        """
158        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
159
160        Args:
161            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
162            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
163        
164        Returns:
165            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
166        """
167        total_beads = 0
168        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
169        axis_list = [0,1,2]
170        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
171        for pid in particle_id_list:
172            total_beads +=1 
173            for axis in axis_list:
174                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
175        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
176        return center_of_mass

Calculates the center of mass of type name.

Arguments:
  • molecule_id(int): Id of the molecule to be centered.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
Returns:

center_of_mass(lst): Coordinates of the center of mass.

def calculate_HH(self, sequence, pH_list=None, pka_set=None): 
178    def calculate_HH(self, sequence, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
179        """
180        Calculates the ideal Henderson-Hasselbach titration curve of `sequence`.
181
182        Args:
183            sequence(`lst`): List of `name`s of particles.
184            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
185            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
186
187        Returns:
188            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbach prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
189
190        Note:
191            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
192            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
193        """
194        if pH_list is None:
195            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
196        if pka_set is None:
197            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
198        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
199        Z_HH=[]
200        for pH_value in pH_list:    
201            Z=0
202            for name in sequence: 
203                if name in pka_set.keys():
204                    if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
205                        psi=-1
206                    elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
207                        psi=+1
208                    else:
209                        psi=0
210                    Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))                      
211            Z_HH.append(Z)
212        return Z_HH

Calculates the ideal Henderson-Hasselbach titration curve of sequence.

Arguments:
  • sequence(lst): List of names of particles.
  • pH_list(lst): pH-values to calculate.
  • pka_set(dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
Returns:

Z_HH (lst): Henderson-Hasselbach prediction of the charge of sequence in pH_list

Note:
  • If no pH_list is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
  • If no pka_set is given, the pKa values are taken from pmb.df
def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system): 
214    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box (self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
215        """
216        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
217        
218        Args:
219            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
220            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
221        """
222        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
223        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
224        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
225        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
226        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
227            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
228            for pid in particle_id_list:
229                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
230                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
231        return

Centers the pmb object matching molecule_id in the center of the simulation box in espresso_md.

Arguments:
  • molecule_id(int): Id of the molecule to be centered.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index, key): 
233    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self,index,key):
234        """
235        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
236
237        Args:
238            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
239            key(`str`): Column label to check.
240
241        Returns:
242            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
243        """
244        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
245        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])

Checks if a cell in the pmb.df at the specified index and column has a value.

Arguments:
  • index(int): Index of the row to check.
  • key(str): Column label to check.
Returns:

bool: True if the cell has a value, False otherwise.

def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined): 
247    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df (self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
248        """
249        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
250
251        Args:
252            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
253            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
254
255        Returns:
256            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
257        """
258        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
259            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
260            if  current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
261                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
262            return True            
263        else:
264            return False

Checks if name is defined in pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): label to check if defined in pmb.df.
  • pmb_type_to_be_defined(str): pmb object type corresponding to name.
Returns:

bool: True for success, False otherwise.

def check_pka_set(self, pka_set): 
266    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
267        """
268        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
269       
270        Args:
271            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
272        """
273        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
274        for required_key in required_keys:
275            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
276                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
277                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
278        return

Checks that pka_set has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.

Arguments:
  • pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
def clean_df_row( self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=['particle_id', 'particle_id2', 'residue_id', 'molecule_id']): 
280    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
281        """
282        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by asigning them a np.nan value.
283
284        Args:
285            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
286            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
287        """   
288        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
289            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
290        return

Cleans the columns of pmb.df in columns_keys_to_clean of the row with index index by asigning them a np.nan value.

Arguments:
  • index(int): Index of the row to clean.
  • columns_keys_to_clean(list of str, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [particle_id, particle_id2, residue_id, molecule_id].
def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies): 
292    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
293        '''
294        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
295
296        Args:
297            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
298            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
299            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
300        
301        Note:
302            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
303        '''
304
305        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
306        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
307            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
308        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
309        if number_of_copies != 1:
