310            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
311                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
312            else:
313                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
314                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
315                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
316            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
317            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
318        else:
319            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
320                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
321                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
322                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
323                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
324        return

Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • column_name(str): Column name to use as a filter.
  • number_of_copies(int): number of copies of name to be created.
Note:
  • Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id"
def create_added_salt_in_espresso(self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt): 
326    def create_added_salt_in_espresso(self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
327        """
328        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
329
330        Args:
331            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of a espresso system object.
332            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
333            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
334            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
335            
336        Returns:
337            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
338        """
339        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
340        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
341        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
342            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
343        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
344            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be positive, charge ', anion_name_charge)
345        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
346        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
347        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
348            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
349            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
350        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
351            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
352            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
353        else:
354            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
355        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
356        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
357        self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
358        self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
359        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
360        return c_salt_calculated

Creates a c_salt concentration of cation_name and anion_name ions into the espresso_system.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system (obj): instance of a espresso system object.
  • cation_name(str): name of a particle with a positive charge.
  • anion_name(str): name of a particle with a negative charge.
  • c_salt (float): Salt concentration.
Returns:

c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to espresso_system.

def create_counterions_in_espresso(self, pmb_object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system): 
362    def create_counterions_in_espresso(self, pmb_object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
363        """
364        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
365        
366        Args:
367            pmb_object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
368            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
369            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
370            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
371
372        Returns: 
373            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
374        """
375        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
376        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
377        object_ids = self.df.loc [self.df['pmb_type']== pmb_object_name].particle_id.dropna().tolist()
378        counterion_number={}
379        object_charge={}
380        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
381            object_charge[name]=0
382        for id in object_ids:
383            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
384                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
385            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
386                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
387        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
388            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
389        else:
390            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
391        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
392            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
393        else:
394            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
395        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
396            self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
397        else:
398            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
399        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
400            self.create_particle_in_espresso(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
401        else:
402            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
403        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
404        for name in counterion_number.keys():
405            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
406        return counterion_number

Creates particles of cation_name and anion_name in espresso_system to counter the net charge of pmb_object.

Arguments:
  • pmb_object_name(str): name of a pymbe object.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • cation_name(str): name of a particle with a positive charge.
  • anion_name(str): name of a particle with a negative charge.

Returns: counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}

def create_molecule_in_espresso( self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False): 
408    def create_molecule_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_molecules,espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
409        """
410        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
411
412        Args:
413            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
414            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
415            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
416            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
417            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
418        Returns:
419            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
420        """
421        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
422            return
423        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
424                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
425            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
426        first_residue = True
427        molecule_info = []
428        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
429        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
430                        column_name='molecule_id',
431                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
432        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
433        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
434        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
435        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:          
436            self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
437            if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
438                molecule_id = 0        
439            else:
440                # check if a residue is part of another molecule
441                check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
442                pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
443                if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == 'molecule' :              
444                    for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
445                        if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
446                            molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
447                            break
448                else:
449                    molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
450            #assigns molecule_id to the residue defined       
451            self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
452                                index=int (molecule_index),
453                                new_value=molecule_id, 
454                                warning=False)
455            for residue in residue_list:
456                if first_residue:
457                    residue_position = first_residue_position
458                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
459                                                                radius=1, 
460                                                                n_samples=1)[0]
461                    residues_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=residue,
462                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
463                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
464                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
465                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
466                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
467                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
468                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
469                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
470                                            index=int (index),
471                                            new_value=molecule_id)
472                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
473                    previous_residue = residue
474                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
475                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
476                    first_residue = False          
477                else:                    
478                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
479                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
480                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
481                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
482                                            hard_check=True, 
483                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
484                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*bond.params.get('r_0')  
485                    residues_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=residue, 
486                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
487                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
488                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
489                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
490                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
491                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
492                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
493                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
494                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
495                                                index=int (index),
496                                                new_value=molecule_id,
497                                                warning=False)            
498                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
499                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
500                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
501                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
502                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
503                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
504                    previous_residue = residue                    
505                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
506            first_residue = True
507        return molecule_info

Creates number_of_molecules molecule of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the molecule type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
  • number_of_molecules(int): Number of molecules of type name to be created.
  • first_residue_position(list, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
  • use_default_bond(bool, optional): Controls if a bond of type default is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in pymbe.df
Returns:

molecules_info (dict): {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}}

def create_particle_in_espresso( self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False): 
509    def create_particle_in_espresso(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
510        """
511        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
512        
513        Args:
514            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
515            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
516            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
517            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
518            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
519        Returns:
520            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
521        """       
522        if number_of_particles <=0:
523            return
524        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
525            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
526        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
527        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
528        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
529        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
530        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
531        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
532        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
533        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
534        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
535        created_pid_list=[]
536        for index in range (number_of_particles):
537            df_index=int (index_list[index])
538            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
539            if position is None:
540                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
541            else:
542                particle_position = position[index]
543            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
544                bead_id = 0
545            else:
546                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
547            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
548            
549            espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
550            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
551        return created_pid_list

Creates number_of_particles particles of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Label of the particle type to be created. name must be a particle defined in pmb_df.
  • espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • number_of_particles (int): Number of particles to be created.
  • position (list of [float,float,float], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
  • fix(bool, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
Returns:

created_pid_list(list of float): List with the ids of the particles created into espresso_system.

def create_pmb_object_in_espresso( self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False): 
553    def create_pmb_object_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
554        """
555        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
556        
557        Args:
558            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
559            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
560            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a espresso system object from espressomd library.
561            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
562            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
563
564        Note:
565            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
566        """
567        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
568        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
569        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
570            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
571        if pmb_type == 'particle':
572            self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
573        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
574            self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
575        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
576            self.create_molecule_in_espresso(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
577        return

Creates all particles associated to pmb object into espresso a number of times equal to number_of_objects.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Unique label of the pmb object to be created.
  • number_of_objects(int): Number of pmb objects to be created.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a espresso system object from espressomd library.
  • position(list): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
  • use_default_bond(bool,optional): Controls if a default bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in pmb.df. Defaults to False.
Note:
  • If no position is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length.
def create_protein_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, positions): 
579    def create_protein_in_espresso(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, positions):
580        """
581        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` in the coordinates in `positions`
582
583        Args:
584            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
585            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
586            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
587            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
588        """
589        import re 
590        if number_of_proteins <=0:
591            return
592        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
593                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
594            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
595
596        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
597
598        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
599        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
600        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
601        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
602        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:          
603            self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
604            if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
605                molecule_id = 0        
606            else:
607                # check if a residue is part of another molecule
608                check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
609                pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
610                if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == 'protein' :              
611                    for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
612                        if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
613                            molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
614                            break
615                else:
616                    molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
617
618            #assigns molecule_id to the protein defined       
619            self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
620                                index=int(molecule_index),
621                                new_value=molecule_id, 
622                                warning=False)
623
624            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
625                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
626                                                                        n_samples=1, 
627                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
628   
629            for residue in positions.keys():
630                residue_name = re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
631                residue_number = re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
632                residue_position = positions[residue]['initial_pos']
633                position = residue_position + protein_center
634                particle_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=residue_name,
635                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
636                                                            number_of_particles=1,
637                                                            position=[position], 
638                                                            fix = True)
639
640                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
641
642                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
643                                            index=int (index),
644                                            new_value=residue_number)
645
646                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
647                                        index=int (index),
648                                        new_value=molecule_id)
649                
650            if molecule_index == min(protein_index_list):
651                self.setup_particle_diameter(positions=positions)
652
653        return

Creates number_of_proteins molecule of type name into espresso_system in the coordinates in positions

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the protein to be created.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • number_of_proteins(int): Number of proteins to be created.
  • positions(dict): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
def create_residue_in_espresso( self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None, use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None): 
655    def create_residue_in_espresso (self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
656        """
657        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
658
659        Args:
660            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
661            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
662            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
663            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
664            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
665            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
666        Returns:
667            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
668        """
669        if number_of_residues <= 0:
670            return
671        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
672                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
673            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
674        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
675        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
676                            column_name='residue_id',
677                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
678        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
679        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
680        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
681        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
682        residues_info={}
683        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
684            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
685            # Assign a residue_id
686            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
687                residue_id=0
688            else:
689                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
690            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
691            # create the principal bead
692            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
693                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
694            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
695            central_bead_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=central_bead_name,
696                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
697                                                                position=central_bead_position,
698                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
699            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
700            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
701            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
702            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
703            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
704            residues_info[residue_id]={}
705            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
706            # create the lateral beads  
707            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
708            side_chain_beads_ids = []
709            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
710                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
711                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
712                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
713                if pmb_type == 'particle':
714                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
715                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
716                            hard_check=True, use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
717                    if backbone_vector is None:
718                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
719                                                              radius=bond.params.get('r_0'), 
720                                                            n_samples=1)[0]
721                    else:
722                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
723                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
724                                                                            radius=bond.params.get('r_0'))
725                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle_in_espresso(name=side_chain_element, 
726                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
727                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
728                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
729                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
730                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
731                                        index=int (index),
732                                        new_value=residue_id, 
733                                        warning=False)
734                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
735                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
736                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
737                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
738                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
739                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
740                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
741                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
742                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
743                                            hard_check=True, 
744                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
745                    if backbone_vector is None:
746                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
747                                                                radius=bond.params.get('r_0'), 
748                                                                n_samples=1)[0]
749                    else:
750                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
751                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
752                                                                                radius=bond.params.get('r_0'))
753                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue_in_espresso(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
754                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
755                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
756                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
757                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
758                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
759                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
760                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
761                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
762                                        index=int(index),
763                                        new_value=residue_id, 
764                                        warning=False)
765                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
766                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
767                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
768                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
769                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
770                                            index=int (index),
771                                            new_value=residue_id, 
772                                            warning=False)
773                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
774                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
775                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
776                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
777            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
778            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
779        return  residues_info

Creates number_of_residues residues of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the residue type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
  • number_of_residue(int): Number of residues of type name to be created.
  • central_bead_position(list of float): Position of the central bead.
  • use_default_bond (bool): Switch to control if a bond of type default is used to bond particle whose bonds types are not defined in pmb.df
  • backbone_vector (list of float): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to backbone_vector.
Returns:

residues_info (dict): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}

def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict): 
781    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
782        """
783        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
784
785        Args:
786            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
787        Returns:
788            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
789        """        
790        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
791        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
792        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
793
794        return variable_with_units

Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in variable_dict.

Arguments:
  • variable_dict(dict): {'value': value, 'units': units}
Returns:

variable_with_units(obj): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.

def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence): 
796    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence (self, sequence):
797        '''
798        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
799
800        Args:
801            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
802
803        Note:
804            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to aminoacid names using the standard  one letter code.
805        '''
806
807        already_defined_AA=[]
808        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
809        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
810
811        for residue_name in sequence:
812            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
813                continue
814            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
815                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
816            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
817                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
818            else:
819                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
820        return

Defines in pmb.df all the different particles in sequence.

Arguments:
  • sequence(lst): Sequence of the peptide or protein.
Note:
  • It assumes that the names in sequence correspond to aminoacid names using the standard one letter code.
def define_bond(self, bond_object, particle_name1, particle_name2): 
822    def define_bond(self, bond_object, particle_name1, particle_name2):
823        """
824        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
825        
826        Args:
827            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
828            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
829            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded..
830        """    
831        index = len(self.df)
832        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
833            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
834        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
835        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
836        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
837                                key=('pmb_type',''),
838                                new_value='bond')
839        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
840                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
841                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
842        return

Defines a pmb object of type bond in pymbe.df

Arguments:
  • bond_object (cls): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
  • particle_name1 (str): name of the first particle to be bonded.
  • particle_name2 (str): name of the second particle to be bonded..
def define_default_bond(self, bond_object): 
844    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object):
845        """
846        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
847
848        Args:
849            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
850        """
851        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
852            return
853        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
854            index = max(self.df.index)+1
855        else:
856            index = 0
857        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
858        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
859        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
860                            key=('pmb_type',''),
861                            new_value='bond')
862        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
863                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
864                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
865        return

Asigns bond in pmb.df as the default bond.

Arguments:
  • bond (obj): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict): 
867    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles (self, eps_dict):
868        '''
869        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
870
871        Args:
872            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
873        '''
874        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
875            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
876            for index in label_list:
877                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
878                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
879                        index=int (index),
880                        new_value=epsilon)
881        return

Defines the epsilon value of the particles in eps_dict into the pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • eps_dict(dict): {'name': epsilon}
def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list): 
884    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
885        """
886        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
887
888        Args:
889            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
890            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
891        """
892        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
893            return
894        index = len(self.df)
895        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
896        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
897        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
898        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type molecule in pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the molecule.
  • residue_list (list of str): List of the names of the residues in the sequence of the molecule.
def define_particle( self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None): 
900    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
901        """
902        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in  `pymbe.df`
903
904        Args:
905            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
906            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
907            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
908            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
909            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
910            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
911        """ 
912        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
913            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
914        else:
915            index = len(self.df)
916            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
917            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
918            
919        if diameter:
920            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
921        if epsilon:
922            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
923        
924        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
925        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type particle in pymbe.df

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the particle.
  • q (int, optional): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
  • diameter (obj, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the particle, should have units of length using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • epsilon (obj, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the particle, should have units of energy using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
  • acidity (str, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is acidic or basic, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to inert.
  • pka (float, optional): If particle is an acid or a base, it defines its pka-value. Defaults to None.
def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model): 
927    def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model):
928        """
929        Defines a pyMBE object of type `peptide` in the `pymbe.df`.
930
931        Args:
932            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `peptide`.
933            sequence (`string`): Sequence of the `peptide`.
934            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per aminoacid are supported.
935        """
936        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name = name, pmb_type_to_be_defined='peptide'):
937            valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
938            if model not in valid_keys:
939                raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
940            clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=sequence)
941            residue_list = []
942            for residue_name in clean_sequence:
943                if model == '1beadAA':
944                    central_bead = residue_name
945                    side_chains = []
946                elif model == '2beadAA':
947                    # terminal groups + glycine are represented with only 1 bead
948                    if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
949                        central_bead = residue_name
950                        side_chains = []
951                    else:
952                        central_bead = 'CA'
953                        side_chains = [residue_name]
954                if residue_name not in residue_list: 
955                    self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
956                                        central_bead = central_bead,
957                                        side_chains = side_chains)
958                residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
959            self.define_molecule(name = name, residue_list=residue_list)
960            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == name].index.item() 
961            self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
962            self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence
963        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type peptide in the pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the peptide.
  • sequence (string): Sequence of the peptide.
  • model (string): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per aminoacid are supported.
def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains): 
965    def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains):
966        """
967        Defines a pyMBE object of type `residue` in `pymbe.df`.
968
969        Args:
970            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `residue`.
971            central_bead (`str`): `name` of the `particle` to be placed as central_bead of the `residue`.
972            side_chains (`list` of `str`): List of `name`s of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the `residue`. Currently, only pmb_objects of type `particle`s or `residue`s are supported.
973        """
974        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
975            return
976        index = len(self.df)
977        self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
978        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'residue'
979        self.df.at [index,'central_bead'] = central_bead
980        self.df.at [index,('side_chains','')] = side_chains
981        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type residue in pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the residue.
  • central_bead (str): name of the particle to be placed as central_bead of the residue.
  • side_chains (list of str): List of names of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the residue. Currently, only pmb_objects of type particles or residues are supported.
def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system): 
 983    def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system):
 984        """
 985        Destroys all particles associated with `name` in `espresso_system` amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from `pmb.df` 
 986
 987        Args:
 988            name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in `pymbe.df`.
 989            espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
 990
 991        Note:
 992            - If `name`  is a object_type=`particle`, only the mathcing particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. `residue`, `molecule`) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
 993        """
 994        allowed_objects = ['particle','residue','molecule']
 995        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 996        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 997            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 998        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 999            particles_index = self.df.index[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna()) 
1000                                                  & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())]
1001            particle_ids_list= self.df.loc[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna())
1002                                                 & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())].particle_id.tolist()
1003            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1004                espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1005            self.df = self.df.drop(index=particles_index)
1006        if pmb_type == 'residue':
1007            residues_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].residue_id.to_list()
1008            for residue_id in residues_id:
1009                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1010                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['residue_id'] == residue_id].index)
1011                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1012                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1013                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)    
1014        if pmb_type == 'molecule':
1015            molecules_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].molecule_id.to_list()
1016            for molecule_id in molecules_id:
1017                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1018                
1019                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['molecule_id'] == molecule_id].index)
1020                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1021                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()   
1022                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)             
1023        
1024        self.df.reset_index(drop=True,inplace=True)
1025
1026        return

Destroys all particles associated with name in espresso_system amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from pmb.df

Arguments:
  • name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in pymbe.df.
  • espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
Note:
  • If name is a object_type=particle, only the mathcing particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. residue, molecule) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
def filter_df(self, pmb_type): 
1028    def filter_df (self, pmb_type):
1029        """
1030        Filters `pmb.df` and returns a sub-set of it containing only rows with pmb_object_type=`pmb_type` and non-Nan columns.
1031        
1032        Args:
1033            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to filter in `pmb.df`.
1034        Returns:
1035            pmb_type_df(`obj`): filtered `pmb.df`.
1036        """
1037        pmb_type_df = self.df.loc[self.df['pmb_type']== pmb_type]
1038        pmb_type_df = pmb_type_df.dropna( axis=1, thresh=1)
1039        return pmb_type_df

Filters pmb.df and returns a sub-set of it containing only rows with pmb_object_type=pmb_type and non-Nan columns.

Arguments:
  • pmb_type(str): pmb_object_type to filter in pmb.df.
Returns:

pmb_type_df(obj): filtered pmb.df.

def find_bond_key(self, particle_name1, particle_name2, use_default_bond=False): 
1041    def find_bond_key(self,particle_name1, particle_name2, use_default_bond=False):
1042        """
1043        Searches for the `name`  of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1044        
1045        Args:
1046            particle_name1(`str`): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1047            particle_name2(`str`): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1048            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to 'False'. 
1049
1050        Returns:
1051            bond_key (str): `name` of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` 
1052
1053        Note:
1054            - If `use_default_bond`=`True`, it returns "default" if no key is found.
1055        """
1056        bond_keys = [particle_name1 +'-'+ particle_name2, particle_name2 +'-'+ particle_name1 ]
1057        bond_defined=False
1058        for bond_key in bond_keys:
1059            if bond_key in self.df.values:
1060                bond_defined=True
1061                correct_key=bond_key
1062                break
1063        if bond_defined:
1064            return correct_key
1065        elif use_default_bond:
1066            return 'default'
1067        else:
1068            return

Searches for the name of the bond between particle_name1 and particle_name2 in pymbe.df and returns it.

Arguments:
  • particle_name1(str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
  • particle_name2(str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
  • use_default_bond(bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between particle_name1 and particle_name2. Defaults to 'False'.
Returns:

bond_key (str): name of the bond between particle_name1 and particle_name2

Note:
  • If use_default_bond=True, it returns "default" if no key is found.
def find_value_from_es_type(self, es_type, column_name): 
1070    def find_value_from_es_type(self, es_type, column_name):
1071        """
1072        Finds a value in `pmb.df` for a `column_name` and `es_type` pair.
1073
1074        Args:
1075            es_type(`int`): value of the espresso type
1076            column_name(`str`): name of the column in `pymbe.df`
1077
1078        Returns:
1079            Value in `pymbe.df` matching  `column_name` and `es_type`
1080        """
1081        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
1082        for state in ['state_one', 'state_two']:
1083            index = self.np.where(self.df[(state, 'es_type')] == es_type)[0]
1084            
1085            if len(index) > 0:
1086                if column_name == 'label':
1087                    label = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(state,column_name)]]
1088                    return label
1089                else: 
1090                    column_name_value = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(column_name,'')]]
1091                    return column_name_value
1092        return None

Finds a value in pmb.df for a column_name and es_type pair.

Arguments:
  • es_type(int): value of the espresso type
  • column_name(str): name of the column in pymbe.df
Returns:

Value in pymbe.df matching column_name and es_type

def generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(self, center, radius, max_dist, n_samples): 
1094    def generate_coordinates_outside_sphere (self, center, radius, max_dist, n_samples):
1095
1096        """
1097        Generates coordinates outside a sphere centered.
1098
1099        Args:
1100            center(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of the sphere.
1101            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1102            max_dist(`float`): Maximum distance from the center of the spahre to generate coordinates.
1103            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points.
1104
1105        Returns:
1106            coord_list(`lst`): Coordinates of the sample points.
1107        """
1108        if not radius > 0: 
1109            raise ValueError (f'The value of {radius} must be a positive value')
1110        if not radius < max_dist:
1111            raise ValueError(f'The min_dist ({radius} must be lower than the max_dist ({max_dist}))')
1112        coord_list = []
1113        for _ in range(n_samples):
1114            rand = self.np.random.random() 
1115            rad = radius + rand*(max_dist-radius)
1116            coord = self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=rad,n_samples=1)[0]
1117            coord_list.append (coord)
1118        return coord_list

Generates coordinates outside a sphere centered.

Arguments:
  • center(lst): Coordinates of the center of the sphere.
  • radius(float): Radius of the sphere.
  • max_dist(float): Maximum distance from the center of the spahre to generate coordinates.
  • n_samples(int): Number of sample points.
Returns:

coord_list(lst): Coordinates of the sample points.

def generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(self, vector, center, radius): 
1120    def generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(self, vector, center, radius):
1121        """
1122        Generates a random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1123        
1124        Args:
1125            vector(`lst`): Coordinates of the vector.
1126            magnitude(`float`): magnitude of the vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1127
1128        Returns:
1129            perpendicular_vector(`np.array`): random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1130        """
1131        np_vec=self.np.array(vector)
1132        if np_vec[1] == 0 and np_vec[2] == 0 and np_vec[0] == 1:
1133            raise ValueError('zero vector')
1134        perp_vec = self.np.cross(np_vec, self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=radius, n_samples=1)[0])
1135        norm_perp_vec = perp_vec/self.np.linalg.norm(perp_vec)
1136        return center+norm_perp_vec*radius

Generates a random vector perpendicular to vector.

Arguments:
  • vector(lst): Coordinates of the vector.
  • magnitude(float): magnitude of the vector perpendicular to vector.
Returns:

perpendicular_vector(np.array): random vector perpendicular to vector.

def generate_trialvectors(self, center, radius, n_samples, seed=None): 
1138    def generate_trialvectors (self,center, radius, n_samples, seed=None):
1139        """
1140        Uniformly samples points from a hypersphere.
1141        
1142        Args:
1143            center(`lst`): Array with the coordinates of the center of the spheres.
1144            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1145            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points to generate inside the sphere.
1146            seed (`int`, optional): Seed for the random number generator
1147
1148        Returns:
1149            samples(`list`): Coordinates of the sample points inside the hypersphere.
1150
1151        Note:
1152            - Algorithm from: https://baezortega.github.io/2018/10/14/hypersphere-sampling/
1153        """
1154        # initial values
1155        center=self.np.array(center)
1156        d = center.shape[0]
1157        # sample n_samples points in d dimensions from a standard normal distribution
1158        rng = self.np.random.default_rng(seed)
1159        samples = rng.normal(size=(n_samples, d))
1160        # make the samples lie on the surface of the unit hypersphere
1161        normalize_radii = self.np.linalg.norm(samples, axis=1)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1162        samples /= normalize_radii
1163        # make the samples lie inside the hypersphere with the correct density
1164        uniform_points = rng.uniform(size=n_samples)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1165        new_radii = self.np.power(uniform_points, 1/d)
1166        samples *= new_radii
1167        # scale the points to have the correct radius and center
1168        samples = samples * radius + center
1169        return samples

Uniformly samples points from a hypersphere.

Arguments:
  • center(lst): Array with the coordinates of the center of the spheres.
  • radius(float): Radius of the sphere.
  • n_samples(int): Number of sample points to generate inside the sphere.
  • seed (int, optional): Seed for the random number generator
Returns:

samples(list): Coordinates of the sample points inside the hypersphere.

Note:
  • Algorithm from: https://baezortega.github.io/2018/10/14/hypersphere-sampling/
def get_charge_map(self): 
1171    def get_charge_map (self):
1172        '''
1173        Gets the charge of each `espresso_type` in `pymbe.df`.
1174        
1175        Returns:
1176            charge_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: charge}.
1177        '''
1178        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1179            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna()     
1180            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()  
1181        else:    
1182            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1183            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1184                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()   
1185            else:
1186                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1187        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.charge.values,index=df_state_one.es_type.values)
1188        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.charge.values,index=df_state_two.es_type.values)
1189        charge_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1190        return charge_map

Gets the charge of each espresso_type in pymbe.df.

Returns:

charge_map(dict): {espresso_type: charge}.

def get_pka_set(self): 
1192    def get_pka_set(self):
1193        '''
1194        Gets the pka-values and acidities of the particles with acid/base properties in `pmb.df`
1195        
1196        Returns:
1197            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
1198        '''
1199        titratables_AA_df = self.df[[('name',''),('pka',''),('acidity','')]].drop_duplicates().dropna()
1200        pka_set = {}
1201        for index in titratables_AA_df.name.keys():
1202            name = titratables_AA_df.name[index]
1203            pka_value = titratables_AA_df.pka[index]
1204            acidity = titratables_AA_df.acidity[index]   
1205            pka_set[name] = {'pka_value':pka_value,'acidity':acidity}
1206        return pka_set

Gets the pka-values and acidities of the particles with acid/base properties in pmb.df

Returns:

pka_set(dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}

def get_radius_map(self): 
1208    def get_radius_map(self):
1209        '''
1210        Gets the diameter of each `espresso type` in `pmb.df`. 
1211        
1212        Returns:
1213            radius_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: radius}.
1214
1215        '''
1216
1217        df_state_one = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_one','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1218        df_state_two = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_two','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1219
1220        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_one.state_one.es_type.values)
1221        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_two.state_two.es_type.values)
1222        radius_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1223        
1224        return radius_map

Gets the diameter of each espresso type in pmb.df.

Returns:

radius_map(dict): {espresso_type: radius}.

def get_type_map(self): 
1226    def get_type_map(self):
1227        """
1228        Gets all different espresso types assigned to particles  in `pmb.df`.
1229        
1230        Returns:
1231            type_map(`dict`): {"name": espresso_type}.
1232        """
1233        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1234            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna(how='all')     
1235            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')  
1236        else:    
1237            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1238            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1239                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')   
1240            else:
1241                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1242        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.es_type.values,index=df_state_one.label)
1243        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.es_type.values,index=df_state_two.label)
1244        type_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1245        return type_map

Gets all different espresso types assigned to particles in pmb.df.

Returns:

type_map(dict): {"name": espresso_type}.

def load_interaction_parameters(self, filename, verbose=False): 
1247    def load_interaction_parameters (self, filename, verbose=False):
1248        """
1249        Loads the interaction parameters stored in filename into `pmb.df`
1250        
1251        Args:
1252            filename(`str`): name of the file to be read
1253            verbose(`bool`): switches on/off the reading prints
1254        """
1255        from espressomd import interactions
1256        without_units = ['q','es_type','acidity']
1257        with_units = ['diameter','epsilon']
1258        with open(filename) as f:
1259            for line in f:
1260                if line[0] == '#':
1261                    continue
1262                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1263                object_type=param_dict['object_type']
1264                if object_type == 'particle':
1265                    not_requiered_attributes={}    
1266                    for not_requiered_key in without_units+with_units:
1267                        if not_requiered_key in param_dict.keys():
1268                            if not_requiered_key in with_units:
1269                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key))
1270                            elif not_requiered_key in without_units:
1271                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key)
1272                        else:
1273                            if not_requiered_key == 'acidity':
1274                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key] = 'inert'
1275                            else:    
1276                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=None
1277                    self.define_particle(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1278                                    q=not_requiered_attributes.pop('q'),
1279                                    diameter=not_requiered_attributes.pop('diameter'),
1280                                    acidity=not_requiered_attributes.pop('acidity'),
1281                                    epsilon=not_requiered_attributes.pop('epsilon'))
1282                elif object_type == 'residue':
1283                    self.define_residue (name = param_dict.pop('name'),
1284                                        central_bead = param_dict.pop('central_bead_name'),
1285                                        side_chains = param_dict.pop('side_chains_names'))
1286                elif object_type == 'molecule':
1287                    self.define_molecule(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1288                                        residue_list=param_dict.pop('residue_name_list'))
1289                elif object_type == 'peptide':
1290                    self.define_peptide(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1291                                        sequence=param_dict.pop('sequence'),
1292                                        model=param_dict.pop('model'))
1293                elif object_type == 'bond':
1294                    name1 = param_dict.pop('name1')
1295                    name2 = param_dict.pop('name2')
1296                    bond_type = param_dict.pop('bond_type')
1297                    if bond_type == 'harmonic':
1298                        k = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('k'))
1299                        r_0 = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('r_0'))
1300                        bond = interactions.HarmonicBond(k=k.to('reduced_energy / reduced_length**2').magnitude, r_0=r_0.to('reduced_length').magnitude)
1301                    else:
1302                        raise ValueError("current implementation of pyMBE only supports harmonic bonds")
1303                    self.define_bond(bond_object=bond, particle_name1=name1, particle_name2=name2)
1304                else:
1305                    raise ValueError(object_type+' is not a known pmb object type')
1306                if verbose:
1307                    print('Added: '+line)
1308        return

Loads the interaction parameters stored in filename into pmb.df

Arguments:
  • filename(str): name of the file to be read
  • verbose(bool): switches on/off the reading prints
def load_pka_set(self, filename, verbose=False): 
1312    def load_pka_set(self,filename, verbose=False):
1313        """
1314        Loads the pka_set stored in `filename` into `pmb.df`.
1315        
1316        Args:
1317            filename(`str`): name of the file with the pka set to be loaded. Expected format is {name:{"acidity": acidity, "pka_value":pka_value}}.
1318            verbose(`bool`, optional): If activated, the function reports each pKa value loaded. Defaults to False
1319
1320        Note:
1321            - If `name` is already defined in the `pymbe.df`, it prints a warning.
1322        """
1323        pKa_list=[]
1324        with open(filename) as f:
1325            for line in f:
1326                if line[0] == '#':
1327                    continue
1328                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1329                pKa_list.append(param_dict)    
1330                if verbose:
1331                    print('Added: '+line)
1332        for pka_set in pKa_list:            
1333            self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1334            for pka_key in pka_set: 
1335                acidity =   pka_set[pka_key]['acidity']        
1336                pka_value = pka_set[pka_key]['pka_value']     
1337                self.define_particle(name=pka_key,acidity=acidity, pka=pka_value)
1338        return

Loads the pka_set stored in filename into pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • filename(str): name of the file with the pka set to be loaded. Expected format is {name:{"acidity": acidity, "pka_value":pka_value}}.
  • verbose(bool, optional): If activated, the function reports each pKa value loaded. Defaults to False
Note:
  • If name is already defined in the pymbe.df, it prints a warning.
def load_protein_vtf_in_df(self, name, filename, unit_length=None): 
1340    def load_protein_vtf_in_df (self, name, filename,unit_length=None):
1341        """
1342        Loads a coarse-grained protein model in a vtf file `filename` into the `pmb.df` and it labels it with `name`.
1343
1344        Args:
1345            name(`str`): Unique label to identify the protein.
1346            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file with the coarse-grained model.
1347            unit_length(`obj`): unit of lenght of the the coordinates in `filename` using the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1348
1349        Returns:
1350            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1351
1352        Note:
1353            - If no `unit_length` is provided, it is assumed that the coordinates are in Angstrom.
1354        """
1355
1356        print (f'Loading protein coarse grain model file: {filename}')
1357
1358        protein_seq_list = []
1359        coord_list = []
1360
1361        label_dict = {}
1362        label_CA = False 
1363
1364        if unit_length == None:
1365            unit_length = 1 * self.units.angstrom 
1366
1367        with open (filename,'r') as protein_model:
1368
1369                for line in protein_model :
1370                    line_split = line.split ()
1371    
1372                    if line_split : 
1373                        line_header = line_split [0]
1374
1375                        if line_header == 'unitcell':    
1376                            box = line_split[1:4]
1377
1378                        elif line_header == 'atom':
1379
1380                            atom_id  = line_split [1]
1381                            atom_name = line_split [3]
1382                            atom_resname = line_split [5]
1383                            chain_id = line_split [7]
1384                            atom_radius = line_split [9]
1385
1386                            diameter = ((float(atom_radius)*2.0)*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1387
1388                            label_dict [int(atom_id)] = [atom_name , atom_resname, chain_id, diameter]
1389
1390                            if atom_name == 'CA' or label_CA == True:
1391                                label_CA = True
1392
1393                            if atom_name != 'CA' and atom_name != 'Ca':
1394                                protein_seq_list.append(atom_name)                        
1395
1396                        elif line_header == 'bond' :
1397                            atom_bond = line_split [1] 
1398
1399                        elif line_header.isnumeric (): 
1400                            particle_id = line_split [0]
1401                            particle_coord = line_split [1:] 
1402                            particle_coord = [float(i) for i in particle_coord]
1403
1404                            coord_list.append (particle_coord)
1405
1406        axes_list = [0,1,2]
1407        updated_coordinates_list = []
1408
1409        # Pablo-NOTE:
1410        # 1- Lines 1397-1403 could be done before in line 1389
1411        # 2- Definir el diametro del CA
1412        # 3- Cambiar load_protein_vtf_in_df por read_protein_vtf --> topology_dict
1413        # 4- Nueva funcion define_protein ()
1414        # 5- Tener cuidado con label_CA
1415        # 6- Limpiar codigo, borrar variables e condiciones innecesarias
1416        # 7- Hacer funciones de las lineas repetidas de codigo entre create_molecule y create_protein (las que hacen copias en el df)
1417
1418        for pos in coord_list:
1419            updated_pos = self.np.zeros(3,)
1420            for axis in axes_list:
1421                updated_pos[axis] = (pos[axis]*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude 
1422            updated_coordinates_list.append (updated_pos.tolist())
1423
1424        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1425
1426        print (f'Protein Sequence: {protein_sequence}')
1427
1428        numbered_resname = []
1429        i = 0   
1430        
1431        for atom_id in label_dict.keys():
1432    
1433            if atom_id == 1:
1434                atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1435                updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1436                numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1437
1438            elif atom_id != 1: 
1439            
1440                if label_dict[atom_id-1][1] != label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1441                    i += 1                    
1442                    count = 1
1443                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1444                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1445                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1446                    
1447                elif label_dict[atom_id-1][1] == label_dict[atom_id][1]:
1448                    if count == 2 or label_dict[atom_id][1] == 'GLY':
1449                        i +=1
