1450                        count = 0
1451                    atom_name = label_dict[atom_id][0]
1452                    updated_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',label_dict[atom_id][2],label_dict[atom_id][3]]
1453                    numbered_resname.append(updated_name)
1454                    count +=1
1455
1456        topology_dict = {}
1457
1458        for i in range (0, len(numbered_resname)):   
1459            topology_dict [numbered_resname[i][0]] = {'initial_pos': updated_coordinates_list[i] ,'chain_id':numbered_resname[i][1], 'diameter':numbered_resname[i][2] }
1460
1461        #### CORTAR
1462
1463        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1464
1465        index = len(self.df)
1466        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1467        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1468        self.df.at [index,'model'] = '2beadAA' 
1469
1470        if label_CA:
1471            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1472
1473        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1474
1475        residue_list = []
1476
1477        for residue_name in clean_sequence:
1478
1479            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1480
1481                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1482                    central_bead = residue_name
1483                    side_chains = []
1484                else:
1485                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1486                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1487
1488                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1489                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1490                                    side_chains = side_chains)
1491            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1492
1493        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = protein_sequence  
1494        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1495
1496        return topology_dict

Loads a coarse-grained protein model in a vtf file filename into the pmb.df and it labels it with name.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Unique label to identify the protein.
  • filename(str): Path to the vtf file with the coarse-grained model.
  • unit_length(obj): unit of lenght of the the coordinates in filename using the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
Returns:

topology_dict(dict): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}

Note:
  • If no unit_length is provided, it is assumed that the coordinates are in Angstrom.
def print_reduced_units(self): 
1498    def print_reduced_units(self):
1499        """
1500        Prints the  current set of reduced units defined in pyMBE.units.
1501        """
1502        print("\nCurrent set of reduced units:")
1503        unit_length=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_length')
1504        unit_energy=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_energy')
1505        unit_charge=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_charge')
1506        print(unit_length.to('nm'), "=", unit_length)
1507        print(unit_energy.to('J'), "=", unit_energy)
1508        print('Temperature:', (self.kT/self.Kb).to("K"))
1509        print(unit_charge.to('C'), "=", unit_charge)
1510        print()

Prints the current set of reduced units defined in pyMBE.units.

def propose_unused_type(self): 
1512    def propose_unused_type(self):
1513        """
1514        Searches in `pmb.df` all the different particle types defined and returns a new one.
1515
1516        Returns:
1517            unused_type(`int`): unused particle type
1518        """
1519        type_map=self.get_type_map()
1520        if type_map == {}:    
1521            unused_type = 0
1522        else:
1523            unused_type=max(type_map.values())+1    
1524        return unused_type

Searches in pmb.df all the different particle types defined and returns a new one.

Returns:

unused_type(int): unused particle type

def protein_sequence_parser(self, sequence): 
1526    def protein_sequence_parser(self, sequence):
1527        '''
1528        Parses `sequence` to the one letter code for aminoacids.
1529        
1530        Args:
1531            sequence(`str` or `lst`): Sequence of the aminoacid. 
1532
1533        Returns:
1534            clean_sequence(`list`): `sequence` using the one letter code.
1535        
1536        Note:
1537            - Accepted formats for `sequence` are:
1538                - `lst` with one letter or three letter code of each aminoacid in each element
1539                - `str` with the sequence using the one letter code
1540                - `str` with the squence using the three letter code, each aminoacid must be separated by a hyphon "-"
1541        
1542        '''
1543        # Aminoacid key
1544        keys={"ALA": "A",
1545                "ARG": "R",
1546                "ASN": "N",
1547                "ASP": "D",
1548                "CYS": "C",
1549                "GLU": "E",
1550                "GLN": "Q",
1551                "GLY": "G",
1552                "HIS": "H",
1553                "ILE": "I",
1554                "LEU": "L",
1555                "LYS": "K",
1556                "MET": "M",
1557                "PHE": "F",
1558                "PRO": "P",
1559                "SER": "S",
1560                "THR": "T",
1561                "TRP": "W",
1562                "TYR": "Y",
1563                "VAL": "V",
1564                "PSER": "J",
1565                "PTHR": "U",
1566                "PTyr": "Z",
1567                "NH2": "n",
1568                "COOH": "c"}
1569        clean_sequence=[]
1570        if isinstance(sequence, str):
1571            if (sequence.find("-") != -1):
1572                splited_sequence=sequence.split("-")
1573                for residue in splited_sequence:
1574                    if len(residue) == 1:
1575                        if residue in keys.values():
1576                            residue_ok=residue
1577                        else:
1578                            if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1579                                residue_ok=residue.upper()
1580                            else:
1581                                raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue given: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1582                        clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1583                    else:
1584                        if residue in keys.keys():
1585                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue])
1586                        else:
1587                            if (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1588                                clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1589                            else:
1590                                raise ValueError("Unknown  code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1591            else:
1592                for residue in sequence:
1593                    if residue in keys.values():
1594                        residue_ok=residue
1595                    else:
1596                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1597                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1598                        else:
1599                            raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1600                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1601        if isinstance(sequence, list):
1602            for residue in sequence:
1603                    if residue in keys.values():
1604                        residue_ok=residue
1605                    else:
1606                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1607                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1608                        elif (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1609                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1610                        else:
1611                            raise ValueError("Unknown code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1612                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1613        return clean_sequence

Parses sequence to the one letter code for aminoacids.

Arguments:
  • sequence(str or lst): Sequence of the aminoacid.
Returns:

clean_sequence(list): sequence using the one letter code.

Note:
  • Accepted formats for sequence are:
    • lst with one letter or three letter code of each aminoacid in each element
    • str with the sequence using the one letter code
    • str with the squence using the three letter code, each aminoacid must be separated by a hyphon "-"
def search_bond( self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False): 
1615    def search_bond (self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False) :
1616        """
1617        Searches for bonds between the particle types given by `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1618        If `use_default_bond` is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns that default bond instead.
1619        If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return nothing. If `hard_check` is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.
1620
1621        Args:
1622            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1623            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1624            hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False. 
1625            use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to False. 
1626
1627        Returns:
1628            bond (cls): bond object from the espressomd library.
1629        
1630        Note:
1631            - If `use_default_bond`=True and no bond is defined between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`, it returns the default bond defined in `pmb.df`.
1632            - If `hard_check`=`True` stops the code when no bond is found.
1633        """
1634        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1635                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1636                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
1637        if bond_key:
1638            return self.df[self.df['name']==bond_key].bond_object.values[0]
1639        else:
1640            print("Bond not defined between particles ", particle_name1, " and ", particle_name2)    
1641            if hard_check:
1642                exit()
1643            else:
1644                return

Searches for bonds between the particle types given by particle_name1 and particle_name2 in pymbe.df and returns it. If use_default_bond is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns that default bond instead. If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return nothing. If hard_check is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.

Arguments:
  • particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
  • particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
  • hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False.
  • use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between particle_name1 and particle_name2. Defaults to False.
Returns:

bond (cls): bond object from the espressomd library.

Note:
  • If use_default_bond=True and no bond is defined between particle_name1 and particle_name2, it returns the default bond defined in pmb.df.
  • If hard_check=True stops the code when no bond is found.
def set_particle_acidity(self, name, acidity='inert', default_charge=0, pka=None): 
1646    def set_particle_acidity(self, name, acidity='inert', default_charge=0, pka=None):
1647        """
1648        Sets the particle acidity if its acidic or basic creates `state_one` and `state_two` with the protonated and 
1649        deprotonated states. In each state is set: `label`,`charge` and `es_type`. If its inert it will define only `state_one`
1650
1651        Args:
1652            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`. 
1653            acidity (`str`): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1654            default_charge (`int`): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
1655            pka (`float`, optional):  If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1656        """
1657        acidity_valid_keys = ['inert','acidic', 'basic']
1658        if acidity not in acidity_valid_keys:
1659            raise ValueError(self.df[name].name +' provided acidity not supported, valid keys are ', acidity_valid_keys)   
1660        for index in self.df[self.df['name']==name].index:       
1661            if pka:
1662                self.add_value_to_df(key=('pka',''),index=index,new_value=pka)
1663            self.add_value_to_df(key=('acidity',''),index=index,new_value=acidity) 
1664            if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_one','es_type')):
1665                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())  
1666            if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'inert':
1667                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=default_charge)
1668                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1669            else:
1670                protonated_label = f'{name}H'
1671                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=protonated_label)
1672                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
1673                if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_two','es_type')):
1674                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())
1675                if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'acidic':        
1676                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)
1677                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=-1)
1678                elif self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'basic':
1679                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=+1)
1680                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)   
1681        return

Sets the particle acidity if its acidic or basic creates state_one and state_two with the protonated and deprotonated states. In each state is set: label,charge and es_type. If its inert it will define only state_one

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the particle.
  • acidity (str): Identifies whether if the particle is acidic or basic, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to inert.
  • default_charge (int): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
  • pka (float, optional): If particle is an acid or a base, it defines its pka-value. Defaults to None.
def set_reduced_units(self, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None, temperature=None): 
1685    def set_reduced_units(self, unit_length=None,unit_charge=None,temperature=None):
1686        """
1687        Sets the set of reduced units used by pyMBE.units and it prints it.
1688
1689        Args:
1690            unit_length (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of length defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1691            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1692            temperature (`obj`,optional): Temperature of the system, defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
1693
1694        Note:
1695            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
1696            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
1697            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
1698        """
1699        self.units=self.pint.UnitRegistry()
1700        if unit_length is None:
1701            unit_length=0.355*self.units.nm
1702        if temperature is None:
1703            temperature=298.15 * self.units.K
1704        if unit_charge is None:
1705            unit_charge=self.units.e
1706        self.N_A=6.02214076e23 / self.units.mol
1707        self.Kb=1.38064852e-23 * self.units.J / self.units.K
1708        self.e=1.60217662e-19 *self.units.C
1709        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
1710        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT} ')
1711        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
1712        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = {unit_charge}')        
1713        self.print_reduced_units()
1714        return

Sets the set of reduced units used by pyMBE.units and it prints it.

Arguments:
  • unit_length (obj,optional): Reduced unit of length defined using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • unit_charge (obj,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • temperature (obj,optional): Temperature of the system, defined using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
Note:
  • If no temperature is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  • If no unit_length is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  • If no unit_charge is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default.
def setup_constantpH_reactions_in_espresso( self, counter_ion, constant_pH, SEED, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type=False): 
1716    def setup_constantpH_reactions_in_espresso(self, counter_ion, constant_pH, SEED, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
1717        """
1718        Sets up the Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic `particles` defined in `pmb.df` to be sampled in the constant pH ensamble. 
1719
1720        Args:
1721            counter_ion(`str`): `name` of the counter_ion `particle`.
1722            constant_pH(`float`): pH-value.
1723            SEED(`int`): Seed for the random number generator.
1724            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): Bellow this value, no particles will be inserted.
1725            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius per each espresso_type. Defaults to `False`.
1726            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
1727        Returns:
1728            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ConstantpHEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
1729            sucessfull_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
1730        """
1731        from espressomd import reaction_methods
1732        if exclusion_range is None:
1733            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
1734        if pka_set is None:
1735            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
1736        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1737        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
1738            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
1739        else:
1740            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
1741        
1742        RE = reaction_methods.ConstantpHEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
1743                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
1744                                                    seed=SEED, 
1745                                                    constant_pH=constant_pH,
1746                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
1747                                                    )
1748        sucessfull_reactions_labels=[]
1749        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
1750        for name in pka_set.keys():
1751            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
1752                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in sg.type_map')
1753                continue
1754            gamma=10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value']
1755            state_one_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1756            state_two_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
1757            counter_ion_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==counter_ion].state_one.es_type.values[0]
1758            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma,
1759                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
1760                            product_types=[state_two_type, counter_ion_type],
1761                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
1762                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
1763                            counter_ion_type: charge_map[counter_ion_type]})
1764            sucessfull_reactions_labels.append(name)
1765        return RE, sucessfull_reactions_labels

Sets up the Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic particles defined in pmb.df to be sampled in the constant pH ensamble.

Arguments:
  • counter_ion(str): name of the counter_ion particle.
  • constant_pH(float): pH-value.
  • SEED(int): Seed for the random number generator.
  • exclusion_range(float, optional): Bellow this value, no particles will be inserted.
  • use_exclusion_radius_per_type(bool,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius per each espresso_type. Defaults to False.
  • pka_set(dict,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
Returns:

RE (obj): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ConstantpHEnsemble object from the espressomd library. sucessfull_reactions_labels(lst): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.

def setup_df(self): 
1767    def setup_df (self):
1768        """
1769        Sets up the pyMBE's dataframe `pymbe.df`
1770        """
1771
1772        columns_name = self.pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples ([
1773                        ('name',''),
1774                        ('pmb_type',''),
1775                        ('particle_id',''), 
1776                        ('particle_id2',''),
1777                        ('residue_id',''),
1778                        ('molecule_id',''),
1779                        ('acidity',''),
1780                        ('pka',''),
1781                        ('central_bead',''),
1782                        ('side_chains',''),
1783                        ('residue_list',''),
1784                        ('model',''),
1785                        ('diameter',''),
1786                        ('epsilon',''),
1787                        ('state_one','label'),
1788                        ('state_one','es_type'),
1789                        ('state_one','charge'),
1790                        ('state_two','label'),
1791                        ('state_two','es_type'),
1792                        ('state_two','charge'),
1793                        ('sequence',''),
1794                        ('bond_object',''),
1795                        ('parameters_of_the_potential','')
1796                        ])
1797
1798        self.df = self.pd.DataFrame (columns = columns_name)
1799      
1800        return

Sets up the pyMBE's dataframe pymbe.df

def setup_lj_interactions_in_espresso( self, espresso_system, cutoff=None, shift='auto', combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'): 
1803    def setup_lj_interactions_in_espresso (self, espresso_system, cutoff=None, shift='auto', combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'):
1804        """
1805        Sets up the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential between all pairs of particle types with values for `diameter` and `epsilon` stored in `pymbe.df`.
1806        Stores the parameters loaded into  ESPResSo for each type pair in `pymbe.df`.
1807        Assumes that the LJ interactions between all particles will have the same `cutoff`, `shift` and `combining_rule`.
1808        Check the documentation of ESPResSo for more info about the potential https://espressomd.github.io/doc4.2.0/inter_non-bonded.html
1809
1810        Args:
1811            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1812            cutoff(`float`, optional): cut-off length of the LJ potential. Defaults to None.
1813            shift (`string`, optional): If set to `auto` shifts the potential to be continous at `cutoff`. Defaults to `auto`.
1814            combining_rule (`string`, optional): combining rule used to calculate `sigma` and `epsilon` for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
1815
1816        Note:
1817            - If no `cutoff`  is given, its value is set to 2**(1./6.) in reduced_lenght units, corresponding to a purely steric potential.
1818            - Currently, the only `combining_rule` supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
1819        """
1820        from itertools import combinations_with_replacement
1821        sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1822        implemented_combinatiorial_rules = ['Lorentz-Berthelot']
1823        compulsory_parameters_in_df = ['diameter','epsilon']
1824        if combining_rule not in implemented_combinatiorial_rules:
1825            raise ValueError('In the current version of pyMBE, the only combinatorial rules implemented are ', implemented_combinatiorial_rules)
1826        if cutoff is None:
1827            cutoff=2**(1./6.)*self.units('reduced_length')
1828        particles_types_with_LJ_parameters = []
1829        particles_types_without_LJ_parameters= []
1830        for particle_type in self.get_type_map().values():
1831            check_list=[]
1832            for key in compulsory_parameters_in_df:
1833                value_in_df=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle_type,
1834                                                        column_name=key)
1835                check_list.append(self.np.isnan(value_in_df))
1836            if any(check_list):
1837                particles_types_without_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1838            else:
1839                particles_types_with_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
1840        for type_pair in combinations_with_replacement(particles_types_with_LJ_parameters, 2):
1841            pair_parameters={}
1842            for ptype in type_pair:
1843                pair_parameters[ptype]={}
1844                pair_parameters[ptype]["label"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='label')
1845                pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='diameter')
1846                pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='epsilon')
1847            if combining_rule == 'Lorentz-Berthelot':
1848                combined_sigma=0
1849                epsilon=1
1850                for ptype in type_pair:
1851                    combined_sigma+=pair_parameters[ptype]["diameter"]
1852                    epsilon*=pair_parameters[ptype]["epsilon"]
1853                offset=combined_sigma/2.-sigma
1854                epsilon=self.np.sqrt(epsilon)
1855            else:
1856                raise ValueError('Undefined combination rule, please report this bug to the developers')
1857            espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0],type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.set_params(epsilon = epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude, 
1858                                                                                    sigma = sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1859                                                                                    cutoff = cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude,
1860                                                                                    offset = offset.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
1861                                                                                    shift = shift)                                                                                          
1862            index = len(self.df)
1863            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = f'LJ: {pair_parameters[type_pair[0]]["label"]}-{pair_parameters[type_pair[1]]["label"]}'
1864            lj_params=espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0], type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.get_params()
1865            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1866                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1867                                new_value='LennardJones')
1868            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1869                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1870                                new_value=self.json.dumps(lj_params))                
1871        if particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1872            non_parametrized_labels=[]
1873            for ptype in particles_types_without_LJ_parameters:
1874                non_parametrized_labels.append(self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, 
1875                                                                            column_name='label')) 
1876            print('WARNING: missing LJ parameters for the following particle labels:')
1877            print(non_parametrized_labels)
1878            print('no interaction has been added for those particles in ESPResSo')
1879        return

Sets up the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential between all pairs of particle types with values for diameter and epsilon stored in pymbe.df. Stores the parameters loaded into ESPResSo for each type pair in pymbe.df. Assumes that the LJ interactions between all particles will have the same cutoff, shift and combining_rule. Check the documentation of ESPResSo for more info about the potential https://espressomd.github.io/doc4.2.0/inter_non-bonded.html

Arguments:
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • cutoff(float, optional): cut-off length of the LJ potential. Defaults to None.
  • shift (string, optional): If set to auto shifts the potential to be continous at cutoff. Defaults to auto.
  • combining_rule (string, optional): combining rule used to calculate sigma and epsilon for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
Note:
  • If no cutoff is given, its value is set to 2**(1./6.) in reduced_lenght units, corresponding to a purely steric potential.
  • Currently, the only combining_rule supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
def setup_particle_diameter(self, topology_dict): 
1881    def setup_particle_diameter (self,topology_dict):
1882        '''
1883        Sets up the diameter of the particles in `positions`.
1884
1885        Args:
1886            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1887        '''
1888        import re 
1889   
1890        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1891            residue_name = re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1892            residue_number = re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
1893            residue_diameter  = topology_dict[residue]['diameter']
1894            diameter = residue_diameter*self.units.nm
1895            index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_number) & (self.df['name']==residue_name) ].index.values[0]
1896            self.add_value_to_df(key= ('diameter',''),
1897                        index=int (index),
1898                        new_value=diameter)
1899            
1900        return

Sets up the diameter of the particles in positions.

Arguments:
  • topology_dict(dict): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
def write_output_vtf_file(self, espresso_system, filename): 
1902    def write_output_vtf_file (self, espresso_system, filename):
1903        '''
1904        Writes a snapshot of `espresso_system` on the vtf file `filename`.
1905
1906        Args:
1907            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
1908            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file.
1909
1910        '''
1911        box = espresso_system.box_l[0]
1912        with open(filename, mode='w+t') as coordinates:
1913            coordinates.write (f'unitcell {box} {box} {box} \n')
1914            for particle in espresso_system.part: 
1915                type_label = self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle.type, column_name='label')
1916                coordinates.write (f'atom {particle.id} radius 1 name {type_label} type {type_label}\n' )
1917            coordinates.write (f'timestep indexed\n')
1918            for particle in espresso_system.part:
1919                coordinates.write (f'{particle.id} \t {particle.pos[0]} \t {particle.pos[1]} \t {particle.pos[2]}\n')
1920        return

Writes a snapshot of espresso_system on the vtf file filename.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • filename(str): Path to the vtf file.
